commit_message:
Use '=' as separator in Linuxbridge configuration

- Replace ':' with '=' as key-value separator for
  physical_interface_mappings entry in the Linuxbridge configuration
  example file.

- See comment by darragh-oreilly at https://ask.openstack.org/en/question/5125

Change-Id: I8ccd1bcc62f20ac82702c902c85efd62b3aa3344

subject: fix(mongodb): Marker generation creates a bottleneck under heavy load
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6944, 'name': 'Allele Dev', 'email': 'cpp.cabrera@gmail.com', 'username': 'cpp-cabrera'}, {'_account_id': 6971, 'name': 'Malini Kamalambal', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 8497, 'name': 'Oz Akan', 'email': 'ozgurakan@gmail.com', 'username': 'oz'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-18 20:03:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-marconi-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/42/47242/1/check/gate-marconi-pep8/16f739e : SUCCESS in 31s
- gate-marconi-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/42/47242/1/check/gate-marconi-python26/e46ef4f : SUCCESS in 1m 17s
- gate-marconi-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/42/47242/1/check/gate-marconi-python27/bfa0d80 : SUCCESS in 1m 01s
- gate-marconi-python33 http://logs.openstack.org/42/47242/1/check/gate-marconi-python33/8959faf : FAILURE in 14s (non-voting)
- gate-marconi-pypy http://logs.openstack.org/42/47242/1/check/gate-marconi-pypy/143adb8 : SUCCESS in 2m 15s
'}, {'account_id': 6944, 'date': '2013-09-18 21:03:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

This looks good, on a cursory glance. Tentatively +1, until I can get a better look at this tomorrow.

I really like how much simpler posting a message seems. I need to look at the side counter logic to see how it changes the operations.

+1 for removing marconi-gc.

I'd appreciate an answer to my one question.

Thanks for this!"}, {'account_id': 6427, 'date': '2013-09-18 22:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Found a bug in inc_counter, and had to rebase and squash the fix in'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-18 20:01:16.000000000', 'message': "fix(mongodb): Marker generation creates a bottleneck under heavy load

This patch changes markers so that they are generated using a per-queue
side counter. A heuristic is used to mitigate a race condition. Due to the
new semantics, partial inserts are no longer possible due to collisions,
which ended up simplifying the retry logic for posting messages.

As a consequence of this patch, the last message posted no longer needs
to remain in the queue indefinitely, rendering marconi-gc unnecessary,
and so it has been removed.

Also, since the mongod GC worker runs once a minute, the queries no longer
filter out expired-but-not-yet-gc'd messages; on average, a message may
live more than 30 seconds passed it's expected lifetime, but I do not
think that this will harm or complicate any application building on top of
Marconi, practically speaking. That being said, it is worth calling out
in documentation.

Closes-Bug: #1218602

WIP: Use side counter

Change-Id: I9ea97ee7d6057a2d84aed43d2bb5f1905ed1724a

WIP: Remove stuff

Change-Id: I01a6d651f617d8df26ca3b403a8461450c18313b

WIP: Use MongoDB TTL index for GC

Change-Id: I693eed9d010d80ec8f521ecdd08907445415ec25
"}]
commit_message:
fix(mongodb): Marker generation creates a bottleneck under heavy load

This patch changes markers so that they are generated using a per-queue
side counter. A heuristic is used to mitigate a race condition. Due to the
new semantics, partial inserts are no longer possible due to collisions,
which ended up simplifying the retry logic for posting messages.

As a consequence of this patch, the last message posted no longer needs
to remain in the queue indefinitely, rendering marconi-gc unnecessary,
and so it has been removed.

Also, since the mongod GC worker runs once a minute, the queries no longer
filter out expired-but-not-yet-gc'd messages; on average, a message may
live more than 30 seconds passed it's expected lifetime, but I do not
think that this will harm or complicate any application building on top of
Marconi, practically speaking. That being said, it is worth calling out
in documentation.

Closes-Bug: #1218602

WIP: Use side counter

Change-Id: I9ea97ee7d6057a2d84aed43d2bb5f1905ed1724a

WIP: Remove stuff

Change-Id: I01a6d651f617d8df26ca3b403a8461450c18313b

WIP: Use MongoDB TTL index for GC

Change-Id: I693eed9d010d80ec8f521ecdd08907445415ec25

Any reason you want this status code?  Do you have some homegrown stuff that wants to use it?  Is the list complete otherwise?

I think the explanation is a bit long winded getting into how the client should handle the response.  Webob's "explanation" just says "The resource has been moved".  I think "The response to this request can be found under a different URI" would be sufficient.

The RFC also says you can use 302 if you want HTTP 1.0 clients to do the right thing.  Be nice if we had a explanation for 302 in the RESPONSE_REASONS map.'}, {'account_id': 8542, 'date': '2013-09-18 07:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8542, 'date': '2013-09-18 07:13:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Clay Gerrard
Yes, I'm testing an auth filter that uses an external authentication server. Although, many browsers implemented 302 in a way to mimic behavior of 303 (thus violating 302 specification), HTTP/1.1 added 303 and 307 to clear this ambiguity.

And yes, this list is not complete. Other status codes from both HTTP 1.0 and HTTP 1.1 are missing. They are present in webob.exc. Is it a good idea to add all of them to swob knowing that most of them are never used by swob consumers ?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-18 07:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-17 10:19:07.000000000', 'message': 'Add HTTPSeeOther(303) to swob

HTTPSeeOther(303): This method exists primarily to allow the output of a
POST-activated script to redirect the user agent to a selected resource. This
can be used by filters like auth middleware to redirect request to an external
authentication server.

Why not just use 302 instead ?
In case of 302, clients may not follow redirect automatically for POST, PUT and
requests.

HTTP/1.1 RFC: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-10.3.4

Change-Id: I354e2f4f3e3eb6a1553b3d9c60b613d8f0c37531
Signed-off-by: Prashanth Pai <ppai@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-09-17 11:01:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add HTTPSeeOther(303) to swob

HTTPSeeOther(303): This method exists primarily to allow the output of a
POST-activated script to redirect the user agent to a selected resource. This
can be used by filters like auth middleware to redirect request to an external
authentication server.

Why not just use 302 instead ?
In case of 302, clients may not follow redirect automatically for POST, PUT and
requests.

HTTP/1.1 RFC: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-10.3.4

Change-Id: I354e2f4f3e3eb6a1553b3d9c60b613d8f0c37531
Signed-off-by: Prashanth Pai <ppai@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-09-18 07:10:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add HTTPSeeOther(303) and HTTPTemporaryRedirect(307) to swob

RFC 1945 and RFC 2068 specify that the client is not allowed to change the
method on the redirected request.  However, most existing user agent
implementations treat 302 as if it were a 303 response, performing a GET on
the Location field-value regardless of the original request method. The status
codes 303 and 307 have been added for servers that wish to make unambiguously
clear which kind of reaction is expected of the client.

HTTP/1.1 RFC for 302: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-10.3.4
HTTP/1.1 RFC for 307: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-10.3.8

Change-Id: I354e2f4f3e3eb6a1553b3d9c60b613d8f0c37531
Signed-off-by: Prashanth Pai <ppai@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add HTTPSeeOther(303) and HTTPTemporaryRedirect(307) to swob

RFC 1945 and RFC 2068 specify that the client is not allowed to change the
method on the redirected request.  However, most existing user agent
implementations treat 302 as if it were a 303 response, performing a GET on
the Location field-value regardless of the original request method. The status
codes 303 and 307 have been added for servers that wish to make unambiguously
clear which kind of reaction is expected of the client.

HTTP/1.1 RFC for 302: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-10.3.4
HTTP/1.1 RFC for 307: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-10.3.8

Change-Id: I354e2f4f3e3eb6a1553b3d9c60b613d8f0c37531
Signed-off-by: Prashanth Pai <ppai@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix __init__ methods of brick initiator connectors

Wrong order of positional arguments in RemoteFsConnector __init__ call.
This only in RemoteFsConnector.__init__, but I decide also update
__init__ methods of other connectors to avoid errors in future.

Change-Id: I75d2c2d29e0330536e280614db1a13686cfd15e4
Closes-Bug: #1226830

I had the same idea as Alan.  Given our current state of freeze, I'm comfortable with this going in.  We should probably consider opening a bug to refactor at I-1."}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-09-18 21:25:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

My thought is that the id is not actually image metadata at all.  For the sake of a fix, I like the simple solution here.  

For a cleaner fix, I'm tempted to just pass the image id explicitly into the driver's rescue() method.  Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-09-18 21:26:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit 4389f2292a0177c8eedc0a398ceb3c5535a9ef82 appears to have broken
rescue on xenapi. The xenapi driver requires the actual image id to be
in the "image_meta" parameter to the rescue driver.

bug 1227350

Change-Id: Ifce27ab26eb5f998850faeefe5f21a4705439821
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Fix rescue

commit 4389f2292a0177c8eedc0a398ceb3c5535a9ef82 appears to have broken
rescue on xenapi. The xenapi driver requires the actual image id to be
in the "image_meta" parameter to the rescue driver.

bug 1227350

Change-Id: Ifce27ab26eb5f998850faeefe5f21a4705439821

commit_message:
Remap the emails of the committers

Some of the emails that the committers are using
aren't really the right target email, so lets remap
the committers commited 'email' into the right email
instead.

Change-Id: Ib9346c32b4a967401d0c8cc67379337015d8c4d9

commit_message:
Use built-in print() instead of print statement

In python 3 print statement is not supported, so we should use
only print() functions.

Fixes bug 1226943

Change-Id: If88d77982ddbd1eb47265f15a27b747cd8011e76

commit_message:
Update alarm scenario test for correct status codes

The latest version of WSME seems to have fixed the status
codes returned (i.e. 201 for creation, 204 for deletion) so
we updated the scenario test appropriately.

Change-Id: I174e157520f6b9b401ad52c1c086fd37aacafb5f

subject: Should finish allocating network before VM reaches ACTIVE

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 12:12:40.000000000', 'message': 'Should finish allocating network before VM reaches ACTIVE

This patch can fix issues like tempest caused by async
network allocation. Nova uses NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper
to allocate network in an async manner, and this allows
one to start querying for network info before you know
you will need it. Nova will invokes refresh_cache method
to update instance_cache_info after excuting the
allocate_for_instance method as well.

However, nova rest api will query instance_cache_info
directly, thus maybe get the empty network info before
instance_cache_info table has been updated asynchronously.
This suituation that VM has been ACTIVE status and the
network info has not been synchronized yet will bring a
lot of trouble for the caller. So should finish
allocating network before the VM reaches ACTIVE status.

Change-Id: Iab542df1be7d5c9661d717ec596d2a37b975169a
Closes-Bug: #1210483
'}, {'created': '2013-08-22 12:16:52.000000000', 'message': 'Should finish allocating network before VM reaches ACTIVE

This patch can fix issues like tempest caused by async
network allocation. Nova uses NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper
to allocate network in an async manner, and this allows
one to start querying for network info before you know
you will need it. Nova will invokes refresh_cache method
to update instance_cache_info after excuting the
allocate_for_instance method as well.

However, nova rest api will query instance_cache_info
directly, thus maybe get the empty network info before
instance_cache_info table has been updated asynchronously.
This suituation that VM has been ACTIVE status and the
network info has not been synchronized yet will bring a
lot of trouble for the caller. So should finish

Change-Id: Iab542df1be7d5c9661d717ec596d2a37b975169a
Closes-Bug: #1210483

However, nova rest api will query instance_cache_info
directly, thus maybe get the empty network info before
instance_cache_info table has been updated asynchronously.
This situation that VM has been ACTIVE status and the
network info has not been synchronized yet will bring a
lot of trouble for the caller. So should finish

Change-Id: Iab542df1be7d5c9661d717ec596d2a37b975169a
Closes-Bug: #1210483
'}, {'created': '2013-08-25 00:42:03.000000000', 'message': 'Should finish allocating network before VM reaches ACTIVE

This patch can fix issues like tempest caused by async
network allocation. Nova uses NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper
to allocate network in an async manner, and this allows
one to start querying for network info before you know
you will need it. Nova will invoke refresh_cache method
to update instance_cache_info after excuting the
allocate_for_instance method as well.

However, nova rest api will query instance_cache_info
directly, thus maybe get the empty network info before
instance_cache_info table has been updated asynchronously.
Thus will cause VM can exist without a known address
accidentally, the caller is difficult to distinguish
this situation, unless waiting for some internal process
or it will not have an address. So should finish
allocating network before the VM reaches ACTIVE status.
For more detail can refer the bug description.

BTW, almost all create server related unit tests have
coverred this case.

Closes-Bug: #1210483
Change-Id: Iab542df1be7d5c9661d717ec596d2a37b975169a
'}]
commit_message:
Should finish allocating network before VM reaches ACTIVE

This patch can fix issues like tempest caused by async
network allocation. Nova uses NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper
to allocate network in an async manner, and this allows
one to start querying for network info before you know
you will need it. Nova will invoke refresh_cache method
to update instance_cache_info after excuting the
allocate_for_instance method as well.

However, nova rest api will query instance_cache_info
directly, thus maybe get the empty network info before
instance_cache_info table has been updated asynchronously.
Thus will cause VM can exist without a known address
accidentally, the caller is difficult to distinguish
this situation, unless waiting for some internal process
or it will not have an address. So should finish
allocating network before the VM reaches ACTIVE status.
For more detail can refer the bug description.

BTW, almost all create server related unit tests have
coverred this case.

Closes-Bug: #1210483
Change-Id: Iab542df1be7d5c9661d717ec596d2a37b975169a

commit_message:
Fix huawei driver test issues

Replace "params[params.index('-lun')]" with
"params[params.index('-lun') + 1]" to get lun ID correctly.
Replace the invalid controller ID "N" with "B".
Dict CLONED_LUN_INFO has no key provider_location, delete it.

Moreover, simplify the "if..., elif..." module with "getattr"
method in fake recv function.

fixes bug 1225884
Change-Id: Ic4cbf8b07321cdecd6290e8cd90bca1b09dca7fd

commit_message:
Fixes call VolumeNotFound in the invalid argument

A mapping key of 'volume_id' is ignored when we use the non keyword
argument. Thus information in 'volume_id' is lost.  Similarly, in the
case of exception.SnapshotNotFound, information in 'snapshot_id' is
lost.

Change-Id: I1a704cc1866ad9b0d9578e16e77c376a77ea5b3e
Closes-Bug: #1226442

`boot-seed-vm` script.

Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

commit_message:
Add net-tools dependency for Fedora/RHEL/CentOS

A minimal Fedora 19 setup doesn't have `arp` installed which blocks the
`boot-seed-vm` script.

Change-Id: I55e98ba2e4c7b8367b9d0b39a9ae17d8faf1ad43
Signed-off-by: Tomas Sedovic <tomas@sedovic.cz>

commit_message:
Remove github references

OpenStack runs git.openstack.org which is more reliable and responsive
when projects operate within OpenStack Infra. Replace all of the
references to github with referneces to git.openstack.org.

Change-Id: Ib3ece85aba6451801487b0bdbd83147e39d9e155

commit_message:
Use built-in print() instead of print statement

In python 3 print statement is not supported, so we should use
only print() functions.

Fixes bug 1226943

Change-Id: I7b2e4d52fe9050f6a67c44e4cc1237a15ea90b23

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-18 21:12:40.000000000', 'message': "Use lazy umount to avoid race problems with dev

A problem with unmounting the dev filesystem in Ubuntu images caused
the umount of the /dev bind mount to fail, which left it there to be
removed during the mv -t step, causing the build host's /dev to be
wiped out.

The lazy umount will detach it from the filesystem hierarchy and then
clean up the mount reference later.

Change-Id: I8f8cea857c445fb0b4fd02bc063722fb1553c947
"}]
commit_message:
Use lazy umount to avoid race problems with dev

A problem with unmounting the dev filesystem in Ubuntu images caused
the umount of the /dev bind mount to fail, which left it there to be
removed during the mv -t step, causing the build host's /dev to be
wiped out.

The lazy umount will detach it from the filesystem hierarchy and then
clean up the mount reference later.

Change-Id: I8f8cea857c445fb0b4fd02bc063722fb1553c947

commit_message:
Fixes misuse of assertTrue in test scripts

Misuse of assertTrue in places where assertEqual or assertIn should be used.

If assertTrue is used, the test will always pass
if the first argument's boolean cast is True. The second argument
passed to assertTrue() will be regarded as the error message
when the assertion fails.

Fixes bug #1223620

Change-Id: I46b51bf944ba22247901172650ea6867dd525aa7

commit_message:
Updates to use NODE_DIST

Devtest now supports distro variable too in the same way
Toci already did. This renames TOCI_DISTROELEMENT to NODE_DIST
to be consistent with devtest.

Change-Id: I6340a5751e548efecec61cbfb01b24e7ac4f9c99

commit_message:
update tox to 1.6

ceilometer uses 1.6, let's utilise it as well to avoid any
incompatibility when manually running tests.

Change-Id: I9a3323310020381ceeebe7aa86219eff32b92ec1
Fixes: Bug#1226853

commit_message:
DNS names may not map to service catalog values

support an optional value to default target endpoint to a specific
value. add target_endpoint_type to map.conf to set a default

Change-Id: I735dcd8958d6479d6a59d144f81bb18e87bd72e0
Fixes: Bug#1226722

If it's possible, then you should handle that case too."}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2013-07-17 06:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I just started working on the patch for container quotas and I think it would be a good idea to have the whole code for getting the source object size in a separate function. 

Something like this:

content_length = (request.content_length or 0)
copy_from = request.headers.get('X-Copy-From')
if copy_from:
    content_length = get_object_size(container, object)
new_size = int(account_info['bytes']) + content_length

Then we could re-use "get_object_size" for container quotas as well, avoiding code duplication.'}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-07-17 11:42:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-07-17 11:45:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-07-17 11:53:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Christian we probably want to move that get_object_size to some common place if you are going to use it in container_quotas'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2013-08-05 17:05:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@Chmouel: I think swift/proxy/controllers/base.py is a good place to put get_object_size into? get_[account|container]_info is already there. I'll take care of this when submitting the container quota patch (after this patch got merged)"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-08-05 17:50:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think caching per-object information is just going to blow out your cache."}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-08-05 17:52:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: No score

@sam wouldn't be rare on x-copy-from?"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-08-05 18:08:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Well, the only time this helps is if you're doing requests like this:

  * COPY A --> B
  * COPY A --> C
  * COPY A --> D

Otherwise, having that size cached doesn't buy you anything. Is that a common enough use case that we'd want the extra cache pressure?"}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-08-05 19:18:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@sam It's sure the need to get the source object size by having an extra HEAD has a cost but I assume requesting the cache to retrieve object size costs less than having to query for each request the proxy-server and then the objects-server. Furthermore the cache entries will expire after 60 seconds but I can decrease this values or even set it config. Activate or not the cache for that middleware can be configuration too."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-08-05 19:33:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

That's all true. What I'm trying to point out is that the caching won't help unless the same object is being copied multiple times in a short timespan.

Is this a use case you actually have? If so, could you say a little more about it? I've never seen someone copy the same object to multiple destinations.

With that said, I think that some degree of caching is a good idea, but not in memcache. If you look at get_(account|container)_info, you'll notice that they have two levels of caching. First, they cache things in the request's WSGI environment, and second, they cache in memcache.

I think that caching the object information in the request is a good idea, as it will let container-quota middleware get the object size without making a second HEAD request.

I think that caching the object information in memcache is a bad idea because it is unlikely to be used by a subsequent request, but adds additional cache pressure, potentially forcing out cached account or container information.

Does that make sense? Is there some use case that I'm failing to consider?"}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-08-07 09:39:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@sam Yes you are right and no it's not a use case I have, maybe overengineering ... So i'll remove that memcache strategy and add caching in request as you've suggested it's a good idea if container quota is set too."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-08-07 18:19:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Sounds good to me.

I'd suggest adding a get_object_info method in swift/proxy/controllers/base.py, right near get_account_info and get_container_info, and omit any memcache caching in that method. (Leave a comment that it's an intentional omission, too, or else we'll get an endless stream of bug reports about it.)

I don't know that you'll be able to re-use too much of the helper functions that get_(account|container)_info rely on, as those seem to be written such that teasing apart the two types of caching will be very difficult. Still, I'd aim for similar method signature and return values, just to make life easier for middleware authors."}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-08-09 12:57:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-08-09 13:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-09 13:59:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

(2 inline comments)

Yes, the object info needs to end up cached in the original environment. Otherwise, when someone goes to fix the bug where container quotas ignore X-Copy-From, they'll be unable to re-use the fetched object info.

I'd do something like this with get_object_info:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/4f9WVKPcjJiMdJVw14JQ/

That way you can pass in the path of the source object, and it won't pollute your PATH_INFO, but the object info will make it into the environment without anyone outside of get_object_info() having to worry about what keys are used for caching things."}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-08-21 14:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-08-21 14:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Handle X-Copy-From header in account_quota mw

Content length of the copied object
is checked before allowing the copy
request according to the account
quota set by Reseller.

Fixes: bug #1200271
Change-Id: Ie4700f23466dd149ea5a497e6c72438cf52940fd

commit_message:
Fix a test case of 35chars+

Current test_delete_image_id_is_over_35_character_limit() tests
both non-hex and over 35 characters of image_id.
test_delete_image_id_is_over_35_character_limit() should test
only over 35 characters of image_id because of its name and comment.

Change-Id: Ie1674a540fa540f4d31edccbbeea293a1eb75e6d

[{'created': '2013-09-18 12:41:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add venv tox environment for taball generation

The jenkins job for creating a sdist tarball uses
tox -evenv, which was missing here.

Change-Id: I864605d6b8e7bd362e2e77eb8d9e5806283c2116
Fixes: Bug #1202978
'}]
commit_message:
Add venv tox environment for taball generation

The jenkins job for creating a sdist tarball uses
tox -evenv, which was missing here.

Change-Id: I864605d6b8e7bd362e2e77eb8d9e5806283c2116
Fixes: Bug #1202978

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-17 08:46:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add a function for creating a server on a given network.

For enabling tenant network connectivity checks when tenant networks
are not reachable, connectivity will be checked verifying if an
instance can be reached from another instance on the same network.

To this aim it will be necessary to boot additional servers.
This patch refactors _create_servers extracting the code for starting
a single server into its own method.

This method will allow the caller to choose on which networks the
server should be booted. This will be useful for other useful test
cases such as verifying tenant connectivity across distinct networks
connected by a router.

Partial-Bug #1226158

Change-Id: I0051eb1a2ef4113a624517b15775c9c0d7bfef1d
'}, {'created': '2013-09-17 13:08:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add a function for creating a server on a given network

For enabling tenant network connectivity checks when tenant networks
are not reachable, connectivity will be checked verifying if an
instance can be reached from another instance on the same network.

To this aim it will be necessary to boot additional servers.
This patch refactors _create_servers extracting the code for starting
a single server into its own method.

This method will allow the caller to choose on which networks the
server should be booted. This will be useful for other useful test

connected by a router.

Partial-Bug #1226158

Change-Id: I0051eb1a2ef4113a624517b15775c9c0d7bfef1d

commit_message:
Add a function for creating a server on a given network

For enabling tenant network connectivity checks when tenant networks
are not reachable, connectivity will be checked verifying if an
instance can be reached from another instance on the same network.

To this aim it will be necessary to boot additional servers.
This patch refactors _create_servers extracting the code for starting
a single server into its own method.

This method will allow the caller to choose on which networks the
server should be booted. This will be useful for other useful test
cases such as verifying tenant connectivity across distinct networks
connected by a router.

Partial-Bug #1226158

Change-Id: I0051eb1a2ef4113a624517b15775c9c0d7bfef1d

[{'created': '2013-09-18 19:03:31.000000000', 'message': 'Make bootstrap arch match what we use for flavors

Previously the nova.conf in the bootstrap image would could get a
mismatch cpu_arch from the flavor extra specs used elsewhere in
TOCI. This change updates our extra specs so that we make extra
specs match (should all be amd64 when using 64bit).

Change-Id: Icb0d5ec2dd809884a16f8aaaa2954b78fac6ea96
'}]
commit_message:
Make bootstrap arch match what we use for flavors

Previously the nova.conf in the bootstrap image would could get a
mismatch cpu_arch from the flavor extra specs used elsewhere in
TOCI. This change updates our extra specs so that we make extra
specs match (should all be amd64 when using 64bit).

Change-Id: Icb0d5ec2dd809884a16f8aaaa2954b78fac6ea96

commit_message:
Sync w/ latest heat stack-create commands

Updates our 'heat stack-create' commands so that they match what we
use in devtest story.

Adds 3 new env vars to set admin token and the default
passwords for the under/over clouds.

Change-Id: I05f0f899265a735fea77d186771f16604f26beb9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-18 18:43:06.000000000', 'message': "Remove unneeded Barbican worker script from generated RPM.

An unneeded script (bin/barbican-worker) was being specified in the setup.py
file, but not specified in the RPM spec file as it is not needed for deployment.
This was leading to an 'unneeded file' error in the RPM build process. This
change removes that unneeded file from setup.py.

Change-Id: Ib9913ca152fc333f9e7ef9f1f749b2907970bd35
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unneeded Barbican worker script from generated RPM.

An unneeded script (bin/barbican-worker) was being specified in the setup.py
file, but not specified in the RPM spec file as it is not needed for deployment.
This was leading to an 'unneeded file' error in the RPM build process. This
change removes that unneeded file from setup.py.

Change-Id: Ib9913ca152fc333f9e7ef9f1f749b2907970bd35

Change-Id: I4c11e1d16132856cc5f103c8fa231413c5b5c546

commit_message:
remove client suffix from command line client

All other OpenStack clients are just called $project, not
${project}client. Make it consistent with those.

Change-Id: I4c11e1d16132856cc5f103c8fa231413c5b5c546

Decode the non-english username str to unicode

commit_message:
Make compute manager call quota_reserve through conductor

Commit 6e8737c3aa52889394e843272f3a7e5a3a5935c1 added a quota_reserve()
call in compute manager that in turn hits the db directly.

This change adds a new conductor proxy method for quota_reserve that
the manager can use.

Change-Id: Ida84117e997bc7a8b87407efeef5072981e691a1
Closes-Bug: #1226759

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 19:10:18.000000000', 'message': 'Check tenant connectivity when tenant networks are unreachable

Bug 1226158

Verify tenant network connectivity by starting a second VM instance
and pinging it from the first one, which was spawn when validating
server creation.
To this aim, this patch inverts the order of _assign_floating_ip and
_check_tenant_network_connectivity in order to guarantee the first
VM already has a floating IP when pinging the second.

Change-Id: If2eea34e363ed40e9a0b38173534184d02a9078f
'}, {'created': '2013-09-17 08:46:11.000000000', 'message': 'Move _check_tenant_network_connectivity to the end.

For enabling tenant network connectivity checks when tenant networks
are not reachable, connectivity will be checked verifying if an
instance can be reached from another instance on the same network.

In order to do so, the instance from which the command is issued
must be accessible from the tempest test runner; and this will be
achieved associating a floating IP to it, which is exactly what
_check_public_network_connectivity does. By executing it first,
the floating IP association will be already available when
checking tenant network connectivity.

Partial-Bug #1226158

Change-Id: If2eea34e363ed40e9a0b38173534184d02a9078f
'}, {'created': '2013-09-17 13:08:51.000000000', 'message': 'Move _check_tenant_network_connectivity to the end

For enabling tenant network connectivity checks when tenant networks
are not reachable, connectivity will be checked verifying if an
instance can be reached from another instance on the same network.

In order to do so, the instance from which the command is issued
must be accessible from the tempest test runner; and this will be
achieved associating a floating IP to it, which is exactly what
_check_public_network_connectivity does. By executing it first,
the floating IP association will be already available when
checking tenant network connectivity.

Partial-Bug #1226158

Change-Id: If2eea34e363ed40e9a0b38173534184d02a9078f
'}]
commit_message:
Move _check_tenant_network_connectivity to the end

For enabling tenant network connectivity checks when tenant networks
are not reachable, connectivity will be checked verifying if an
instance can be reached from another instance on the same network.

In order to do so, the instance from which the command is issued
must be accessible from the tempest test runner; and this will be
achieved associating a floating IP to it, which is exactly what
_check_public_network_connectivity does. By executing it first,
the floating IP association will be already available when
checking tenant network connectivity.

Partial-Bug #1226158

Change-Id: If2eea34e363ed40e9a0b38173534184d02a9078f

commit_message:
Add 'Field' to the title of the Field Guides

In several field guides, the title doesn't have 'Field'.
This causes inconsistency in the tempest documentation.
 http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/#field-guides
This commit adds 'Field' word to the field guides.

Change-Id: I0379442da59f66b1f5a0e755e5383c56b2a46688

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-17 23:12:55.000000000', 'message': 'Make virt drivers use a consistent hostname

Right now, the virt drivers will happily return the hostname
of a system, even if it has changed since the compute service has
started. The problem with this is that DNS issues can cause the
service to constantly delete and re-create itself in the database
leading to flaky scheduling without the operator knowing.

This patch makes them cache the hostname at the first call, and
log a visible error message if the hostname changes during the
lifetime of the process so that the admin can see what is
going on.

NOTE: This excludes hyperv and vmwareapi until further study of
if this is appropriate to do for those drivers as well, as they
can manage multiple systems behind a single compute host.

(cherry-picked from commit 277c07b605d606a6787935d86cf6a749ed92aec0)

Closes-bug: 1224982
Change-Id: I4ef64f9715ff117f50120846d8b43ee7183a0b42

commit_message:
Make virt drivers use a consistent hostname

Right now, the virt drivers will happily return the hostname
of a system, even if it has changed since the compute service has
started. The problem with this is that DNS issues can cause the
service to constantly delete and re-create itself in the database
leading to flaky scheduling without the operator knowing.

This patch makes them cache the hostname at the first call, and
log a visible error message if the hostname changes during the
lifetime of the process so that the admin can see what is
going on.

NOTE: This excludes hyperv and vmwareapi until further study of
if this is appropriate to do for those drivers as well, as they
can manage multiple systems behind a single compute host.

(cherry-picked from commit 277c07b605d606a6787935d86cf6a749ed92aec0)

Closes-bug: 1224982
Change-Id: I4ef64f9715ff117f50120846d8b43ee7183a0b42

[{'created': '2013-09-04 20:36:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix secure delete for LVM snapshots

This change modifies the behaviour of the secure delete for LVM
snapshots to wipe the underlying COW of the snapshot LV instead of
the snapshot LV itself.

This change is necessary because the snapshot LV does not contain
exactly the same number of writable blocks as the original LV.  The
COW includes header information per COW block that identifies the
 device as a COW device as well as the source and destination blocks
for the changed item.  The amount of metadata contained in the COW is
variable based on I/O performed on the snapshot.

This does not change the behavior of secure deletes on normal LVs.

Change-Id: I308b554429ac981d709c19b78cdc00389a3f598a
Closes-Bug: #1191812
'}, {'created': '2013-09-16 18:51:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix secure delete for thick LVM snapshots

commit_message:
Fix secure delete for thick LVM snapshots

This change modifies the behaviour of the secure delete for thick
LVM snapshots to wipe the underlying COW of the snapshot LV
instead of the snapshot LV itself.

This change is necessary because the snapshot LV does not contain
exactly the same number of writable blocks as the original LV.  The
COW includes header information per COW block that identifies the
 device as a COW device as well as the source and destination blocks
for the changed item.  The amount of metadata contained in the COW is
variable based on I/O performed on the snapshot.

This does not change the behavior of secure deletes on thin LVs
or secure deletes on the thick LV snapshot origin.

Closes-Bug: #1191812
Change-Id: I308b554429ac981d709c19b78cdc00389a3f598a

commit_message:
Split out nova-bm-dnsmasq.

To migrate to using Neutron's DHCP agent (and get away from file
injection) we need to stop using the workaround pool based dnsmasq
DHCP server. We may need to build either configuration until the
Neutron DHCP agent is stable and working, so rather than deleting,
lets split it into a dedicated element.

Change-Id: I11a048c6d0974dc613cd27509e3e9574a85cbc45

commit_message:
Split neutron-dhcp-agent into it's own element.

For undercloud control planes we need the Neutron DHCP agent but not
the L3 agent or metadata agent (at this point anyhow). Without the
DHCP agent we can't start using the Neutron integrated DHCP PXE
booting facility, which is a prerequisite for disabling file
injection.

Change-Id: I46fe856009472aedebba1b1d5a3ad9698ff6d29b

commit_message:
Set a few more conf values for trove to be fully functional

In order for the trove-api to be fully functional, trove.conf needs
to have a few more values pertaining to roles and extensions set.

Change-Id: I425ee4b748d7a071e9cfc89fa2eaa159547d20f7

In commit 3d96f85 (review I22c8d70e3e70f2d2421915da66c2618688e0db2b)
we added a refresh=False kwarg to get_available_nodes() but forgot to
add the arg to the baremetal and vmware drivers.

Use the kwarg in tests to catch this case.

Change-Id: Ib7998aafefdeac47bfad53614927c0346f193adf
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing get_available_nodes() refresh arg

In commit 3d96f85 (review I22c8d70e3e70f2d2421915da66c2618688e0db2b)
we added a refresh=False kwarg to get_available_nodes() but forgot to
add the arg to the baremetal and vmware drivers.

Use the kwarg in tests to catch this case.

Change-Id: Ib7998aafefdeac47bfad53614927c0346f193adf

commit_message:
Add task status tracking

Task state is storing in database and updating with db.api methods.
Task uuid is stored in self.task_uuid property of engine.
Added method `update_status' in base engine class.

Blueprint db-task-track

Change-Id: I34be803d3f0566e62321e064fdf46b37145348e0

[{'created': '2013-09-16 20:27:42.000000000', 'message': "Don't display non-tenant Floating IP in Floating IP project tab

Previously Floating IPs from all tenants are displayed when logged
in as a user with admin role and Neutron is enabled. Neutron API
returns resources from all tenants when the API is called with admin
role, so we need to call the API with additional filter parameter to
limit the results to a given tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1226224
Change-Id: I47ddf77cd3c5d4c6141a67cb32c22cc917b485e6
"}, {'created': '2013-09-16 22:59:30.000000000', 'message': "Don't display non-tenant Floating IP in Floating IP project tab

Previously Floating IPs from all tenants are displayed when logged
in as a user with admin role and Neutron is enabled. Neutron API
returns resources from all tenants when the API is called with admin
role, so we need to call the API with additional filter parameter to

Closes-Bug: #1226224
Change-Id: I47ddf77cd3c5d4c6141a67cb32c22cc917b485e6
"}]
commit_message:
Don't display non-tenant Floating IP in Floating IP project tab

Previously Floating IPs from all tenants are displayed when logged
in as a user with admin role and Neutron is enabled. Neutron API
returns resources from all tenants when the API is called with admin
role, so we need to call the API with additional filter parameter to
limit the results to a given tenant.

Closes-Bug: #1226224
Change-Id: I47ddf77cd3c5d4c6141a67cb32c22cc917b485e6

commit_message:
Fix misused assertTrue in unit tests

Refactored unit tests to use assertEqual instead of assertTrue
where needed.

Fixes bug #1226374

Change-Id: I87308eb7871a55ef0fc49ca466311ed202b62d47

commit_message:
devtest: prepend scripts dir to $PATH

I had an older version of python-keystoneclient installed in /usr and
everything was broken because e.g. 'keystone role-get admin' doesn't
work with that version.

Change-Id: Ifa32ae1245b69fffee60c0ef1d8013b964347868

commit_message:
Document neutron vpn service properties

This adds descriptions to the properties of:
* OS::Neutron::VPNService
* OS::Neutron::IPsecSiteConnection
* OS::Neutron::IKEPolicy
* OS::Neutron::IPsecPolicy
as well as gettext wrapping for the attributes description

Change-Id: I3312cfbeeccee925e6b06b7ac061be16997bdd34
Closes-Bug: #1224182

Add update-snapshot test

* change method test_snapshot_create_get_list_delete for VolumesSnapshotTest
* add method update_snapshot for SnapshotsClientJSON & SnapshotsClientXML

Well, Marc, actually my initial version goes to requirements.txt, while mtreinish suggest me to check-in to test-requirements.txt.


,----------- quoted form the irc talk
| <mtreinish> the commit message looks fine but you should put the requirement
|             in test-requirements.txt                                    [13:21]
| <DennyZhang> why not requirements.txt?                                  [13:22]
| <mtreinish> requirements.txt is the place for imports that are required to run
|             tempest tests. (in other words a direct import somwhere in the
|             tempest/tempest directory)                                  [13:24]
| <mtreinish> since the subunit import is in the colorizer which is just a tool
|             we use in run_tests.sh it should go in test_requirements
| <DennyZhang> Thanks a lot for the education, matthew. I will make the change
|              right now.                                                 [13:25]
| <mtreinish> I know it is a bit confusing because subunit is a requirement for
|             running tempest with testr. But, it is really a requirement for
|             testrepository not tempest.                                 [13:26]
`-----------'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-09-16 14:08:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

@DennyZhang this is an example why you shouldn't abandon commits for rebases an use git commit --amend. The review log would have cleared this up because the previous revision with it in requirements would be listed.

@Marc test-requirements is the proper place for it because it's only a direct requirement on colorizer.py which is not required for tempest to run. (just run_tests.sh)"}, {'account_id': 8641, 'date': '2013-09-16 15:01:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add missing import of 'subunit' in test-requirements.txt

 tools/colorized.py import subunit
 however test-requirements.txt doesn't note this.

 Closes-Bug: #1224155

Change-Id: I4e1a8ee449c4fcf733116809de41e86d10f17e85

[{'created': '2013-09-13 21:40:28.000000000', 'message': "Optimizations to Ring.get_more_nodes()

When we're looking for handoffs, we first try to span all the regions,
then zones, then devices. However, the search loops would always go
over a big subset of the ring, regardless of whether or not there was
anything left to find.

In particular, this would result in long runtimes for the first call
to get_more_nodes() if you didn't have more regions than replicas, as
the region-search loop would chew through a ton of devices and not
find any (since there weren't any). Now we do a little arithmetic,
think about the pigeonhole principle a little bit, and bail out when
there's nothing left to find, rather than waiting until there's no
space left to search.

Similar changes were made for the different-zone and different-device
search loops.

On a 4800-device test ring (4 regions, 5 zones each, 20 node each, 12
drives each), the time to get all handoffs dropped to about 5% of its
previous value (a 95% improvement).

More usefully, on a 1200-device test ring (same as above but only 1
region), the time to get just the first 6 handoffs dropped to about
0.01% of its original runtime, or a 10,000x speedup.

Change-Id: I4c77094186f0032a3e19a099a1a0e71b2ba06719

More usefully, on a 1200-device test ring (same as above but only 1
region), the time to get just the first 6 handoffs dropped to about
0.01% of its original runtime, or a 10,000x speedup.

Fixes bug 1225018.

Change-Id: I4c77094186f0032a3e19a099a1a0e71b2ba06719

commit_message:
Optimizations to Ring.get_more_nodes()

When we're looking for handoffs, we first try to span all the regions,
then zones, then devices. However, the search loops would always go
over a big subset of the ring, regardless of whether or not there was
anything left to find.

In particular, this would result in long runtimes for the first call
to get_more_nodes() if you didn't have more regions than replicas, as
the region-search loop would chew through a ton of devices and not
find any (since there weren't any). Now we do a little arithmetic,
think about the pigeonhole principle a little bit, and bail out when
there's nothing left to find, rather than waiting until there's no
space left to search.

Similar changes were made for the different-zone and different-device
search loops.

On a 4800-device test ring (4 regions, 5 zones each, 20 node each, 12
drives each), the time to get all handoffs dropped to about 5% of its
previous value (a 95% improvement).

More usefully, on a 1200-device test ring (same as above but only 1
region), the time to get just the first 6 handoffs dropped to about
0.01% of its original runtime, or a 10,000x speedup.

Fixes bug 1225018.

Change-Id: I4c77094186f0032a3e19a099a1a0e71b2ba06719

commit_message:
Document autoscaling resource properties

Adds descriptions to the properties of:
* AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration
* AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup
* AWS::AutoScaling::ScalingPolicy
* OS::Heat::InstanceGroup
and wraps attribute descriptions with gettext _(

Change-Id: Ie825c2b122a6c2ce8ff83f9beb9f98487aaa8d54
Closes-Bug: #1224131

commit_message:
Don't allow to set alarm on not owned resource

This change scope automatically the threshold alarm definition to
the project of the alarm owner expect for admin.

And don't allow to create combination alarm if the rule contains
alarm from a other project.

Implements blueprint alarming-logical-combination

Change-Id: I798387b1337fb7cb31d69ba18caf49b75476238a

commit_message:
F18 WordPress_NoKey fixes

The security group properties must be strings or we get validation
errors, and firewall-cmd rule addition should be permanent

Change-Id: Ia03947690ff8142b6e700c808a898283c7b8d095

commit_message:
Add 'repeat_actions' property for OS::Ceilometer::Alarm

The default value is maintained : repeat_actions=False
Require python-ceilometerclient>=1.0.3

Fixes bug #1223347

Change-Id: I010b6555311e9e34b095d9216cf1c5873e244cc4

commit_message:
Add instance_flavor_id to the notification message

Through Ceilometer,We can see the notification message just has
instance_type_id, for example,
    "instance_type" :"m1.nano"
    "instance_type_id": "6",
There is some confusion ,flavorid "42" should be added to the message.

bug 1217429

Change-Id: Id71e9480d243e7fc343bf9f7ea1faf2d87f01541

'}, {'created': '2013-08-03 08:44:53.000000000', 'message': 'Switch delete to use new-world Quotas object

What it says.  Quotas object is now passed to terminate_instance() and

commit_message:
Fix quota direct DB access in compute

This fixes the quota direct DB access in compute by using the new Quota
object.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: Ib6ed6cc3b3f3f49cca1e89c0fb6e501201febd24
Closes-Bug: 1226759

subject: Add new-world Quota object

Want to think about whether more things should move here or not.  Dan has a good point about resources potentially being different in nova-api vs nova-compute as one is upgrading...  (A problem in today's code, but we should consider it here.  Specifically the issue is if you pass in a 'delta' to reserve() that doesn't match a known Resource.  The quota reserve DB code will create an entry for the resource.. but there's no sync method to call, so.. boom.)"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-08-03 09:07:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-03 09:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Add new-world Quota object

Adds a Quota object that can track reservations.  This allows us to be
more OOP-like.  No code uses this yet but a follow-up patch will fix a
bug where compute is querying the DB.

Related to blueprint unified-object-model

Change-Id: I9f435691f12c7c268f754bb23a6330a7a2c419e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-12 21:24:02.000000000', 'message': 'Enhance exception logging in the API to better handle HeatExceptions

HeatExceptions have a 'message' class attribute that holds the
generic error message template, e.g. "The Stack %(stack_name)s could not
be found.", unfortunately, because the names are the same, it was
overshadowing the actual exception instance 'message' field, e.g. "The
Stack my-stack could not be found.".

This patch puts the exception's actual message in a new field called
'msg' so that logging an exception or translating it will work as
expected. Also, a new catch is added specifically to appropriately log
the HeatException message.

Fixes bug: #12244646

Change-Id: I3965bffb1c2c2eee0af440d1ecd30ccb3bb958d5'}, {'created': '2013-09-12 22:33:21.000000000', 'message': 'Enhance exception logging in the API to better handle HeatExceptions

HeatExceptions have a 'message' class attribute that holds the
generic error message template, e.g. "The Stack %(stack_name)s could not
be found.", unfortunately, because the names are the same, it was
overshadowing the actual exception instance 'message' field, e.g. "The
Stack my-stack could not be found.".

This patch puts the exception's actual message in a new field called
'msg' so that logging an exception or translating it will work as
expected. Also, a new catch is added specifically to appropriately log
the HeatException message.

Fixes bug: #12244646

Change-Id: I3965bffb1c2c2eee0af440d1ecd30ccb3bb958d5'}, {'created': '2013-09-12 23:45:46.000000000', 'message': 'Consistent logging in the API to better log exceptions

With this patch we log the actual message of an exception instead of its
str() representation. This allows for consistent error logging in the
API.

Fixes bug: #12244646

Change-Id: I3965bffb1c2c2eee0af440d1ecd30ccb3bb958d5'}, {'created': '2013-09-13 19:19:41.000000000', 'message': 'Consistent logging in the API to better log exceptions

With this patch we log the actual message of an exception instead of its
str() representation. This allows for consistent error logging in the
API.

Fixes bug: #1224646

Change-Id: I3965bffb1c2c2eee0af440d1ecd30ccb3bb958d5
'}]
commit_message:
Consistent logging in the API to better log exceptions

With this patch we log the actual message of an exception instead of its
str() representation. This allows for consistent error logging in the
API.

Fixes bug: #1224646

Change-Id: I3965bffb1c2c2eee0af440d1ecd30ccb3bb958d5

commit_message:
Increase default swift storage

Swift storage is used as glance image back-end. Tempest have cinder to
uploads 1 GiB image from cinder in twice.

In parallel execution in cause an issue, bacuse the current default size is
1_000_000 KiB.

Increasing the default swit storage size from 1_000_000 KiB 4_000_000
KiB when tempest is enabled.

Fixing bug 1225664

Change-Id: Iccd6368e4df71abb5ccfe7d361c64d86e1071d35

commit_message:
Dynamically adjust max number of leases

This change dynamically adjusts the maximum number of leases based on
the size of the subnets associated with a network.  The upper bound is
limited by a configurable option to keep the max reasonable and prevent
denial of service.

Closes bug: 1225200

Change-Id: I75c3907bcf45cd991eadf5dd8c8ad7f1eaab3c85

commit_message:
Add v3 HostManager

Some of the host code required changes to work with the v3 API.
This change adds a v3-compatible HostManager that inherits from
the 1_1 HostManager to make use of the functions that didn't
need to change.

bp v3-api

Change-Id: I3ef7ab4619d49c20ab1bdeb1185ad28b411d37a1

commit_message:
Fix Functional Tests

This patch,
1. Fixes the Auth tests.
2. Adds cleanup for queue tests.
3. Replaces hard coded message counts with config values.
4. Removes skipTests.

Change-Id: I20ec8ced57a032c618331ac416974632170cadd3

Change-Id: Ia92513e89b0c95c5b3b98921e126fdd21cc4f405
"}]
commit_message:
BigSwitch plugin: allow 'external' keyword in router rules

Allows 'external' keyword in addition to 'any' keyword
in BigSwitch router rules support.

Closes-Bug: #1226814
Change-Id: Ia92513e89b0c95c5b3b98921e126fdd21cc4f405

commit_message:
Adding health monitoring test case

Test cases for health monitoring (load balancer) were missing.
I have added list, show, create, update, delete,associate, disassociate
test cases fot health monitoring.

Change-Id: If123d9bf8f11babc760ca8fbcbc0d6c9931d138b

commit_message:
Adding LB member operation test cases

Testcases for LB member operation were missing.
I have added LB member create, delete, update, list and show test cases.
Also xml support for the same is provided.

Change-Id: I0db9a6724856afebbc272f43fc3801cdaf3061e5

so before +2ing this, do we really think that in tempest we're going to test cross region services? I'd much rather just have a global region variable which we use for everything, otherwise it's a lot of extra config variables in the base case.

-1ing to get it off my review list, but am happy to discuss."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-09-04 12:06:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-09-04 14:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I presume the author is planning on testing with regions else why this submission? Arata, can you address the question from Sean? In general I am skeptical about limiting our idea of what tempest will be used to test.'}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-09-05 08:30:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

In most case, having a global region variable is enough. The reason I want to add the options is to cope with the situation below.

I would like to run Tempest in a system where Nova and Swift are on different regions.
Nova is on RegionOne and RegionTwo. Swift is on RegionThree and RegionFour; the service catalog likes below.

    ...
    {
      "type": "compute",
      "endpoints": [
        { "region": "RegionOne", ... },
        { "region": "RegionTwo", ... }
      ]
    },
    {
      "type": "object-store",
      "endpoints": [
        { "region": "RegionThree", ... },
        { "region": "RegionFour", ... }
      ]
    },
    ...
    (Bad configuration? But I have to test this anyway.)

Though I can run tempest with two config files (one for nova and the other for swift), I'm happy if I can do it at once. 

However, I think my case is not a common one. If adding the options considered harmful I don't want to do it. If the problem is only about editing config file (we have to write 7 "region" lines in config file even if all the service use the same region), making *.region default to identity.region may solve it. But actually the problem is simplicity of config/code, right?'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-09-12 14:54:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I was the guy suggesting the multiple config options approach so let me add a bit more about my ideas

I think the initial patch from Arata was actually setting the region for all services from identity.region , while still preserving a way to set a different region per service by subclassing the RestClient

I'd have liked this to be simpler and suggested providing the region name options in the config file to set it accordingly without the need to subclass (also where would a subclass pick up a different region name anyway?)

My reasons for cross-region operations are that while probably not a very common scenario, I think it is fair to use tempest against a region newly deployed but in a pre-existing environment; in that case, having the config options, one would just set those accordingly and maybe even run only a subset of the tests.

So I understand the config options will most of the time just be left untouched and if the trade off for a simpler code/usage isn't worthwhile than we can keep the initial patach from Arata but in the end I think I'd keep the option for the cross-region operations."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-09-12 16:45:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

One slight suggestion, but I like the addition of region for each service."}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-09-13 07:23:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-09-13 07:32:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-09-13 07:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

This is a version that defaults to identity.region'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-13 08:13:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

region for all services. Previously this was done only for the compute
service.

commit_message:
Add "region" config for each service

Added config items are:
    compute.region
    image.region
    network.region
    volume.region
    object_storage.region
    orchestration.region

RestClient decides target endpoints according to these values. If
these values are not set, the value of identity.region is used
instead.

Fixes bug 1210039

Change-Id: If2a01fae2893ee5740a94e97389164eb000538d7

commit_message:
Move nova.conf/neutron.conf database configuration variables to [database] section

Commit https://review.openstack.org/34671 introduced for nova.conf:
"The database configuration variables are now in a new section
 [database]."

This change is also needed for the neutron files.

Change-Id: I3dcc46c163560e6ca277d421acf87a75683fa83d
Partial-Bug: #1205060

commit_message:
Respond with 410 after upload if image was deleted

When updating the image after upload, we should return an
HTTPGone instead of a 500 error if the image cannot
be found.
This will provide more information to nova when this occurs
during snapshotting.

Fixes bug #1217838

Change-Id: I6e9875a9ff95ed3e9c38685785473138327ad4a1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 19:22:35.000000000', 'message': 'Port binding registration with NeutronDbPlugin causes Neutron crash

fixes bug: 1226169

port binding feature of ML2 plugin registers a callback function with
db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2, which is invoked during a query of
port DB. This function is registered by name instead by refefence. This
causes wrong context to be passed to the function upon invocation, which
causes the exception. If this query is made during neutron
initilization, Neutron service will fail to start.

This fix changes the registration from function name to function
pointer

Change-Id: I44f7f1a222f80c9ce35f7d49610e52170f76dfd1
'}, {'created': '2013-09-18 01:41:41.000000000', 'message': 'Port binding registration with NeutronDbPlugin causes Neutron crash

fixes bug: 1226169

port binding feature of ML2 plugin registers a callback function with
db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2, which is invoked during a query of
port DB. This function is registered by name instead by refefence. This
causes wrong context to be passed to the function upon invocation, which
causes the exception. If this query is made during neutron
initilization, Neutron service will fail to start.

This fix changes the registration from function name to function
pointer

Change-Id: I44f7f1a222f80c9ce35f7d49610e52170f76dfd1
'}]
commit_message:
Port binding registration with NeutronDbPlugin causes Neutron crash

fixes bug: 1226169

port binding feature of ML2 plugin registers a callback function with
db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2, which is invoked during a query of
port DB. This function is registered by name instead by refefence. This
causes wrong context to be passed to the function upon invocation, which
causes the exception. If this query is made during neutron
initilization, Neutron service will fail to start.

This fix changes the registration from function name to function
pointer

Change-Id: I44f7f1a222f80c9ce35f7d49610e52170f76dfd1

commit_message:
Fixes call GlanceConnectionFailed in invalid ARG

A mapping key of 'netloc' is always ignored. Thus information in
'netloc' is lost. But because it is included in 'error_msg', I remove
'netloc=netloc'.

Change-Id: I937044bcca0cb196fcd96cfa421de777713d76f5
Closes-Bug: #1226959

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 11:17:31.000000000', 'message': 'Adding new test execution layer.

Now Tester object spawns Printer and WorkerPool.
On request Tester pushes task and repeats number to WorkerPool which can execute tasks
in sequential or concurrect way.
Sequential - WorkerPool pushes one task to each Worker and waits while any Worker will stop
before assigning to first available.
Concurrect - Assigns tasks on workers in round-robin fashion, on Worker side each task
runs in GreenTread which make tests running more concurrent.
After any test execution result is pushed to Printer which will simply print in to stdout.
Any other behaviour should be defined in the react method

Implements: Utilities for test engine
Change-Id: I03bf8ad087bbf1f34c46289d21c309437c72844f
'}, {'created': '2013-09-17 10:04:47.000000000', 'message': 'Adding new test execution layer.

Executing tests in multiprocess.Pool.map with blocking untill execution is done.
Fixing tests as well.

Implements: Utilities for test engine
Change-Id: I03bf8ad087bbf1f34c46289d21c309437c72844f
'}, {'created': '2013-09-17 10:12:22.000000000', 'message': 'Adding new test execution layer.

commit_message:
Adding new test execution layer

Use mulitprocessing.Pool instead of self implementation.

Add timeout to each test. If timeout for single test is not defined
tester will define gloabal timeout = 3600 sec / Number of time test
have to be run.

Implements blueprint test-engine-utils
Change-Id: I03bf8ad087bbf1f34c46289d21c309437c72844f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-17 05:13:29.000000000', 'message': 'Allow display_name for v2 snapshot-update

According to the comment in the source code, the snapshot-update of
v2 would be able to allow either "name" or "display_name" parameter.
And if both paramters are specified, "name" parameter is effective
over "display_name" like "description" parameter.
However "display_name" parameter is ignored now, because cinder writes
over empty dict(update_dict['display_name']).

This patch fixes the problem.

Fixes bug #1226398

Change-Id: Icd48556a26b9346f73b7c1b82ffbcdd469c4d28d
'}]
commit_message:
Allow display_name for v2 snapshot-update

According to the comment in the source code, the snapshot-update of
v2 would be able to allow either "name" or "display_name" parameter.
And if both paramters are specified, "name" parameter is effective
over "display_name" like "description" parameter.
However "display_name" parameter is ignored now, because cinder writes
over empty dict(update_dict['display_name']).

This patch fixes the problem.

Fixes bug #1226398

Change-Id: Icd48556a26b9346f73b7c1b82ffbcdd469c4d28d

commit_message:
Prevent update_port ip_address from matching address_pair

Previously one could update a port to match one of the address_pairs.
This patch prevents that.

Fixes bug: 1223646

Change-Id: Ic8cecfdb83b3fd9d2691bb41e0427cf578577fc8

commit_message:
Use common create_server method for advanced_ops

This patch changes "create server" implementation from each
implementation to the common method for code clean-up.

Change-Id: I04daf642ffdf5df6c7e5822f5f3c2281b0958a03

commit_message:
Fixing two comments regarding bind_port in ml2

Fixes two comment lines regarding when bind_port
is called. The correct comment should indicate that
bind_port is called prior to "create_port_precommit or
update_port_precommit" rather than
"create_network_precommit or update_network_precommit".

Change-Id: I5c0cb49efb43b15fdc5a7f88569e19fcf8d72819

Enable two verbose_names in AttachmentsTable translatable

One is the table name "Attachments".
The other is the column name "Device".

Closes-Bug: #1226966

commit_message:
Fixes incomplete translation support of "Defaults" table

Inside of administration section, some rows of default quotas table
(e.g. Volumes, Metadata Items, Instances, etc.) were coded using its
name instead of a locale value for its translation.

Change-Id: Iccd163f9a9f35358bf9213491301b070368aff04
Closes-Bug: #1224824

[{'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-29 11:08:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

How does the proxy server control this?"}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-07-29 11:21:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Peter,

EC objects will be stored in a new high-level directory, like 'ec_object'. Proxy-server will need to set a specific header 'obj_dir' in each request. E.g. req.headers['obj_dir'] = 'ec_objects'

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-29 18:26:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Let's not go sending paths in requests. I'd much rather send over the storage tier name and have the object server compute the path. That way we don't have to worry about path traversal attacks at all."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-30 02:01:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Agree with Sam, and I am still curious about how the proxy server was going to use this."}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-07-30 11:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-07-30 11:54:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Sam, I've changed a little bit. Now the datadir is extracted from swift.conf. Is this the way preferable? Not sure about the header name is suitable but I could change this later

@Peter, let's say a client uploads a object into a Swift cluster. By default, this object will have 3 replicas and stored in 'objects' directory. This is the current design and works fine if we only use single storage policy(3 replicas)
Now this client may want to apply EC policy(single replica with erasure coded). Proxy will need to write the data into different directories so that the existing object-replicator won't touch it, otherwise the data will be messed up. 
This patch is trying to enable dynamic DATADIR for each read/write request. In order to use this feature, some modification need to be done in objectcontroller. eg, we may add a special header({'storage-policy':'ec'}) when issuing the Get/Put request. W/ this patch, object-server is able to read/write from a different DATADIR."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-30 12:21:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-30 20:12:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I thought this was going to be done per container?

Perhaps use a different DiskFile subclass based on the container property.

To do that, one might have a different object controller in the proxy layer that knows how to talk to the object server using a different URL scheme for the on-disk reference.'}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-07-31 15:49:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Peter, thanks for the info.

Yes, we will also have a patch on proxy side.But for this patch I thought the object-server only needs a small modification - that is just tell the it to read/write to a different top-level directory. It doesn't need to know the detail contents of objects.

IMHO, the detail design still needs lots of discussion. I'm making some early code to see if can help things move on."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-08-13 03:29:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Don't want to hold up the EC work, but it sure seems like getting a solid foundation would enable the work to proceed a lot smoother.

Pushing for using a DiskFile subclass that implements the required behaviors rather than trying to do this one piece at a time.

But don't let me hold this effort up."}, {'account_id': 5189, 'date': '2013-09-18 08:11:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
(WIP)Allow to handle objects in different high-level directory

Replaced static DATADIR with dynamic headers thus proxy-server
could read/write different locations on disk.

This was for EC feature.

Change-Id: Ic35921c588745f53fe55432a0ffdbccbb6b23e8f

commit_message:
Rationalize list_user_projects and get_projects_for_user

These two functions have slightly different implementations and yet neither
takes into account group or inherited roles.  Rationalize these into a single
list_projects_for_user() that gets the correct list of project refs, allowing
for group and inherited roles.  The public API name, as referenced in the
policy file, remains as 'list_user_projects' to avoid a policy file change
at this late stage.

The most common use cases of the above is via the v2 API, when we need
to ensure only projects from the default domain are included.  Given that
this means we must inspect each project ref anyway, having a call that
returns a list of IDs will not be any more efficient than returning the
project refs and letting the caller extract the IDs.

Fixes bug #1201487

Change-Id: I614140639c71dae4dfe501d27eda65e41a78694d

With the switch to lesscpy, the icons were not being displayed on
buttons anymore. Avoiding nested Mixin definitions appears to resolve

Change-Id: I09699fb37f55b989893905f3b8978a17e317f598
Closes-Bug: #1226580

commit_message:
Restore icons on buttons

With the switch to lesscpy, the icons were not being displayed on
buttons anymore. Avoiding nested Mixin definitions appears to resolve
the issue.

Change-Id: I09699fb37f55b989893905f3b8978a17e317f598
Closes-Bug: #1226580

commit_message:
Regenerate POT (English PO) files

If POT files contains translated messages, Transifex seems to use
msgstr rather than msgid as index, and this leads to incorrect
source language strings in Transifex [1].
POT files should not have any strings in msgstr to avoid this problem.

This commit regenerates POT files from scratch.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2013-September/000103.html

Closes-Bug: #1226428
Change-Id: I9aa11323edbfd98b95bbc2c26be337cc77df5e87

commit_message:
Fix use of bare list/dict types in instance_group object

The instance_group object was merged before we had helpers for
dict and list objects of strings. This makes that object use those
for schema safety.

Change-Id: I1f68e43a83f140f7b29b17c0961b267e64e48390
Closes-bug: 1221383

messages:
[{'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-08-20 12:52:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So - we shouldn't be adding config options that have the purpose of making stuff work. And we definitely shouldn't be adding 2 config options for that :)

I would really like to see a more general fix for this. Some lines of thought:
 * Do we care if the volume is created, before we continue here?
 * Why is 30 seconds not a valid timeout and when does it get hit?
 * Maybe make nova have elastic timeouts - have some idea of how many volumes failed like that and then decide to increase it based on the general congestion, or the given source is maybe marked as problematic - remember - we are building a cloud - we can't configure everything for everyone."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-20 13:46:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

(1 inline comment)

Copy-paste gone wrong inline.

Also here is an irc chat with the author of the patch to keep it on the record as it might be useful to other reviewers.

<ndipanov> I am thinking now about the config option
<ndipanov> I would really like to avoid it...
<ndipanov> and I assume it is highly dependant on many things
<ndipanov> so setting it to (say) 75 actually makes no sense
<ndipanov> that's why I don't like conf options that are used 'to make it work'
<ndipanov> we should really think about it more
<yportnova> I totally agree
<yportnova> But we do not have much time for this
<yportnova> And without this bug fixed booting from image with dest type volume won't work in many cases
<ndipanov> what do you mean - many cases...
<ndipanov> I'd say it is highly dependant on your setup and images you use...
<ndipanov> why are you so sure it won't work in 'many cases'
<yportnova> If we use large images or images not in RAW format
<ndipanov> on what sort of backends/cinder volume servers
<ndipanov> what is a large image
<ndipanov> is the bottleneck really inflating them to raw... etc
<ndipanov> I'd really like to know more about this
<ndipanov> see what I'm trying to say
<ndipanov> 'it won't work in our lab setup' won't convince other core people to +2 it either...
<ndipanov> (not saying you only tested it in a lab)
<ndipanov> but you get my point :)
<yportnova> If we have 4 gb image and 1Gb network - we will spend approximately 32 sec for downloading
<yportnova> if I counted right
<ndipanov> rough estimate but yeah...
<ndipanov> OK - let's see what others say... 
<ndipanov> how about adding a more generous timeout for images only
<ndipanov> still not configurable
<ndipanov> but say 2 minutes?
<ndipanov> or a minute
<yportnova> Maybe we can try to count estimate based on image size& 
<ndipanov> Ok leave it like this
<ndipanov> I will get some other core folks to look at it
<ndipanov> for now
<yportnova> ok"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-21 11:30:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Increase volume created checking retries to 60

In some cases 30 retries with 1 sec interval is not enough for
volume to be created.
Increased max tries to 60

Fixes bug 1213953

Change-Id: I6bcd395a4bac940387384cc85691d7219cf90e63

commit_message:
Update README.rst to use testr instead of nose

This commit just changes the references to nose in the project README
to testr. It also adds a sentence about using run_tests.sh and tox.

Change-Id: I7512b7f954c1c83186b1f428e9371261cf50f41b

[{'created': '2013-09-13 00:36:36.000000000', 'message': "Add missing dependency on neutron-server

When installing neutron with the linuxbridge plugin,
a dependency is missing on the package 'neutron-server' which provides
the file /etc/default/neutron-server.

Add a dependency on neutron-server.

Closes-bug: #1224740
Change-Id: I0a9d7195618e21426970e814817b7f87dcba8d8c
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing dependency on neutron-server

When installing neutron with the linuxbridge plugin,
a dependency is missing on the package 'neutron-server' which provides
the file /etc/default/neutron-server.

Add a dependency on neutron-server.

Closes-bug: #1224740
Change-Id: I0a9d7195618e21426970e814817b7f87dcba8d8c

commit_message:
Add ability to configure control_exchange

Add control_exchange parameter with default to 'openstack'.

The control_exchange configuration defaults to 'openstack' in Cinder.

Fixes: bug #1220272
Change-Id: Ic15e471a745568e5183ad9eedba92c213026309e
(cherry picked from commit 15e32b1e4ab513fbe980e84d6585be42385c0ca7)

Enhances and updates bare metal information

Adds back in the section about booting to a specific node/host

- points to correct wiki page
- gives more use cases and context

commit_message:
BigSwitch plugin: passes context to all update_network calls

There were a few calls to update the network on the backend
that were not having the context passed to them so they were
incorrectly using the admin context. This patch corrects that
by passing the context to all network update calls. It also
disallows calls to _send_update_network that don't provide
the context because there is not a use case for that condition.

Closes-Bug: #1226803
Change-Id: I7f0cbb797df9f565d0a00a7c67278cd96301f244

commit_message:
Verify provides and requires

When flow is being constructed we ensure that it is actually valid by
checking its invariants:
- for linear flow, no item should depend on items that are executed
  after it;
- for unordered flow, items should be independent.

We also add check that all necessary provides were injected to storage
before actually running flow.

Implements: blueprint flow-verification
Change-Id: I499898f543505b7dd6f82716ae8f4011cb08f601

commit_message:
Version conflict for 'requests' resolved

Current version of python-cinderclient in pypi requires 'requests<1.2.3',
while current (and installed) version of requests is 1.2.3.
Project's requirements updated to specify version of requests to match
python-cinderclient requirements.

Fixes bug #1221139

Change-Id: I6793fad9ccdbf715962c09b2b1943bed8a9cb1d1

commit_message:
Handle cross instance depends on

Instrument wait condition and wait condition handle to store signals,
using cfn-signal to send signals, using cfn-get-metadata to retrieve
signals, generate script files to invoke.

Change-Id: Ice74daab466cf398b69db7ce1eb45409e788e10c
Implements: blueprint hot-software-config-deps

commit_message:
xenapi: extract vm installation

This change makes it easier to use an existing xva for your XenServer
installation by removing the templating, and using only snapshots. Thus
the OpenStack VM could be exported and re-used to speed up tests. Also
various cleanups has been made.

related to blueprint xenapi-devstack-cleanup

Change-Id: Ie3d4ce69f35d7768016be8dc906808092d8e2df5
