[{'created': '2013-09-16 14:15:28.000000000', 'message': 'Make virt drivers use a consistent hostname

Right now, the virt drivers will happily return the hostname
of a system, even if it has changed since the compute service has
started. The problem with this is that DNS issues can cause the
service to constantly delete and re-create itself in the database
leading to flaky scheduling without the operator knowing.

This patch makes them cache the hostname at the first call, and
log a visible error message if the hostname changes during the
lifetime of the process so that the admin can see what is
going on.

Closes-bug: 1224982

commit_message:
Make virt drivers use a consistent hostname

Right now, the virt drivers will happily return the hostname
of a system, even if it has changed since the compute service has
started. The problem with this is that DNS issues can cause the
service to constantly delete and re-create itself in the database
leading to flaky scheduling without the operator knowing.

This patch makes them cache the hostname at the first call, and
log a visible error message if the hostname changes during the
lifetime of the process so that the admin can see what is
going on.

NOTE: This excludes hyperv and vmwareapi until further study of
if this is appropriate to do for those drivers as well, as they
can manage multiple systems behind a single compute host.

Closes-bug: 1224982
Change-Id: I4ef64f9715ff117f50120846d8b43ee7183a0b42

commit_message:
Remove duplication in disk checks

Split the image and fs resize checks into separate methods since they
are used in different ways. This also strips one redundant size check.

Change-Id: Ie2381fa4ecd5264f2dd3ec3b0350df40376d0e34

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-09 21:22:28.000000000', 'message': "xenapi: Fix download_handler fallback

In order to make image-download a bit more robust, we attempt to download from
a preferred handler and if that fails, we fall back to a default handler.

If the preferred handler *is* the default-handler, then we should just raise
the exception instead of retrying.

The existing code was checking to see with whether the handler *instance*
compared as equal to the default-handler *instance*. Since the two objects are
instantiated separately, they'll always be different objects, so never compare
as equal.

The correct check is to see if the handler is an instance of the default
handler's class.

Fixes bug 1210659

Change-Id: Id038d221fd2f90c36673f30d4ff8acdc8dbf098e

commit_message:
xenapi: Fix download_handler fallback

In order to make image-download a bit more robust, we attempt to download from
a preferred handler and if that fails, we fall back to a default handler.

If the preferred handler *is* the default-handler, then we should just raise
the exception instead of retrying.

The existing code was checking to see with whether the handler *instance*
compared as equal to the default-handler *instance*. Since the two objects are
instantiated separately, they'll always be different objects, so never compare
as equal.

The correct check is to see if the handler is an instance of the default
handler's class.

Fixes bug 1210659

Change-Id: Id038d221fd2f90c36673f30d4ff8acdc8dbf098e

commit_message:
Monkeypatch WebTest to support HTTP PATCH

This allows us to sync with the global-requirements version of
WebTest (i.e. 1.3.3)

commit_message:
Specify LIBVIRT_DEFAULT_URI for nova-compute os-svc-install

This allows baremetal calls from seed to host to work when the host
does not have qemu:///system as the default libvirt uri.
Closes-Bug: #1226310

Change-Id: I1279bb1b303c81a7ae627ee0b579302e5163d398

commit_message:
Allow environment be specified for os-svc-install

This creates environment entries in both upstart and systemd files.

Change-Id: I8ac2658fc9bfc376e91944fdbcb8d98632c40718
Related-Bug: #1226310

So this has only changed when net_ids specified.
In this case, before the patch the query params were:

  tenant_id:id
  shared:False   +    shared:True
  id:net_ids          id:net_ids

and now, the query params are:

  id:net_ids

TBH, the initial query params seem like they should have worked. I.E. the problem seems to be in the neutron side
of things, and we're now relying on id:net_ids implicitly
including all shared networks which seems a bit less flexible."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-09-17 11:46:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The original parameters would have 2 queries instead of one. In addition to this it may result in a 'shared' network being attached to a VM when it was not intended (the shared network was not part of the requested networks)
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-09-17 15:17:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Only return requested network ID's

Only return the requested network ID's and not all of the
public networks. This will also include 'shared' networks.

Fixes bug 1221320

Change-Id: I21ba4586c6e431b0dd1a87a9e5e493fae1b08357

commit_message:
Increase size of peer_address attribute in VPNaaS

Increased the size so that peer_address could be FQDN. API
document changed constraint from IPAddress to string, however
in the plugin/service code, it is already a string and there is
no specific restriction on the value. Database migration will
be performed, due to the size change.

bug 1225128

Change-Id: Idc0d545491074fc0a1a3bd0256fdbba0a3a0718c

commit_message:
Catch exceptions from nova client in poll_and_publish

Ceilometer compute agent dies if nova client raises an exception while it is
retrieving server instances. This might happen e.g. when some OpenStack API is
temporarily unavailable

Conflicts:
	tests/agentbase.py
	tests/compute/test_manager.py

Fixes LP Bug #1218889
Change-Id: I808dcfae18d23240f8e095d6c97c8dede7dede8f
(cherry picked from commit 0e01da763ab7b3783ae86aa6582c38ebdc6e2378)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 18:32:21.000000000', 'message': "Set rootwrap_config path to rootwrap.conf

Other components set
rootwrap_config = /etc/<component>/rootwrap.conf by default.
This commit brings cinder up-to-date with what other
components are doing by setting
rootwrap_config = /etc/cinder/rootwrap.conf by default.

A couple of test cases needed to be updated to handle the change
from 'None'.

Not counting this as a documentation impact as the documentation I
can find already lists /etc/cinder/rootwrap.conf as the default.

Closes-Bug 1226074

Change-Id: I68dd5fea1895a6365d6c69db0535d081c4a3460e
"}]
commit_message:
Set rootwrap_config path to rootwrap.conf

Other components set
rootwrap_config = /etc/<component>/rootwrap.conf by default.
This commit brings cinder up-to-date with what other
components are doing by setting
rootwrap_config = /etc/cinder/rootwrap.conf by default.

A couple of test cases needed to be updated to handle the change
from 'None'.

Not counting this as a documentation impact as the documentation I
can find already lists /etc/cinder/rootwrap.conf as the default.

Closes-Bug 1226074

Change-Id: I68dd5fea1895a6365d6c69db0535d081c4a3460e

The previous name was a mistake, log_facility is already used by all other
openstack modules. This shouldn't bring compatibility issues because the
parameter was only added a few days ago.

Change-Id: Ifcc2f0daf935610fdbac45ac5badf0a4f904b7d3
"}]
commit_message:
Rename parameter 'syslog_facility' into 'log_facility'

The previous name was a mistake, log_facility is already used by all other
openstack modules. This shouldn't bring compatibility issues because the
parameter was only added a few days ago.

Change-Id: Ifcc2f0daf935610fdbac45ac5badf0a4f904b7d3

I've encountered a ValueError when adapting DictOpt to
neutron's network_vlan_ranges.
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini#L23

This patch only split only one colon for every value

Change-Id: Iee4011f2a45be933dad393c72df099d6a8116849
"}, {'created': '2013-09-17 13:46:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix DictOpt to split only the first colon

I've encountered a ValueError when adapting DictOpt to
neutron's network_vlan_ranges.
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini#L23

This patch makes dictopt to split only the first colon for every value

Fixes bug #1223667

Change-Id: Iee4011f2a45be933dad393c72df099d6a8116849
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DictOpt to split only the first colon

I've encountered a ValueError when adapting DictOpt to
neutron's network_vlan_ranges.
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini#L23

This patch makes dictopt to split only the first colon for every value

Fixes bug #1223667

Change-Id: Iee4011f2a45be933dad393c72df099d6a8116849

commit_message:
Fix misused assertTrue in unit tests

Refactored unit tests to use assertEqual instead of assertTrue
where needed.

Fixes bug #1226374

Change-Id: I6826fefbb7c6fed8b0e664da36b144e882fb6d0e

commit_message:
Change Marconi's codebase structure

This patch re-structures Marconi's codebase in a way that it'll be
possible to add other services such as marconi-proxy and
marconi-notification as standalone services within Marconi.

Implements blueprint change-marconi-structure

Change-Id: Id6061f04ec6e6959143fb0f5905bb8799fd86edd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-17 12:10:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix boot-seed-vm/create-nodes for old e2fsprogs

Change Id7f999ea17c84ea61b733cf6d0b74c95fdae0413 introduced
an optimization of FS operations by means of "chattr +C" call.
Ubuntu 12.04 LTS ships e2fsprogs version, that doesn't support
+C option, so both boot-seed-vm and create-nodes scripts fail
on this step.

As it's just an optimization, we can add || true to chattr calls
to ensure boot-seed-vm and create-nodes still work with old
versions of e2fsprogs.

Fixes bug 1226570

Change-Id: I27e94de35b9655cc669b6845522834fc9bac381a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix boot-seed-vm/create-nodes for old e2fsprogs

Change Id7f999ea17c84ea61b733cf6d0b74c95fdae0413 introduced
an optimization of FS operations by means of "chattr +C" call.
Ubuntu 12.04 LTS ships e2fsprogs version, that doesn't support
+C option, so both boot-seed-vm and create-nodes scripts fail
on this step.

As it's just an optimization, we can add || true to chattr calls
to ensure boot-seed-vm and create-nodes still work with old
versions of e2fsprogs.

Fixes bug 1226570

Change-Id: I27e94de35b9655cc669b6845522834fc9bac381a

commit_message:
Revoke user tokens when disabling/delete a project

- Revoke tokens scoped to all users from a project when disabling or
  deleting the project.
- Fix provided by chmouel

Closes-Bug: #1179955
Change-Id: I8ab4713d513b26ced6c37ed026cec9e2df78a5e9

commit_message:
Adding documentation to Tables and Workflows

Adding documentation of DataTable decorators.
Adding documentation and example of complex workflow.

Connecting topics with api reference.

Change-Id: I2653e0c5c52179dcc45cee689cde50afcd6ae0de
Fixes: bug #1212559

[{'created': '2013-09-17 06:57:01.000000000', 'message': 'divides  "import" statement in a url.py

url.py is used as template file,when "run_test.sh -m startpanel" is executed.

It is desirable to divide an "import" statement in a url.py beforehand.

Change-Id: Ibc50e3efbae0d2696d796516a1387633e06cc060
Closes-Bug: #1226427
'}]
commit_message:
divides  "import" statement in a url.py

url.py is used as template file,when "run_test.sh -m startpanel" is executed.

It is desirable to divide an "import" statement in a url.py beforehand.

Change-Id: Ibc50e3efbae0d2696d796516a1387633e06cc060
Closes-Bug: #1226427

Change-Id: Ia1a74b6bb2873e59677a7fea6652a6c006f38175

commit_message:
Fixes Opt types in glance/notifier/notify_kombu.py

Changed rabbit_retry_backoff and rabbit_retry_max_backoff to IntOpt.

Fixes bug #1201697

Change-Id: Ia1a74b6bb2873e59677a7fea6652a6c006f38175
(cherry picked from commit c1d7b5929db0e66539e4ba3cdf91a41547fd7f49)

commit_message:
Use substitutions in the messages of delete confirm form

This allows translators to control the word order.

Change-Id: I6aa894cbe92bc5d209cfb6c5cf869b318fca1225
Closes-Bug: #1224846

messages:
[{'account_id': 6802, 'date': '2013-09-04 19:20:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This change responds to the request for a working key manager implementation that can be used with Cinder volume encryption (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30976/) and ephemeral storage encryption (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/40467/). See the following thread on openstack-dev for more information: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/014572.html

This change has been proposed separately from the aforementioned features so both can mark it as dependencies.'}, {'account_id': 7746, 'date': '2013-09-04 19:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-09-04 19:44:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

besides the Feature Freeze, this looks good'}, {'account_id': 6804, 'date': '2013-09-06 20:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

[Nova] FFE Request: Encrypt Cinder volumes
We request that volume encryption [1] be granted an exception to the feature freeze for Havana-3.  Volume encryption [2] provides a usable layer of protection to user data as it is transmitted through a network and when it is stored on disk. The main patch [2] has been under review since the end of May and had received two +2s in mid-August.  Subsequently, support was requested for booting from encrypted volumes and integrating a working key manager [3][4] as a stipulation for acceptance, and both these requests have been satisfied within the past week. The risk of disruption to deployments from this exception is minimal because the volume encryption feature is unused by default.  Note that the corresponding Cinder support for this feature has already been approved, so acceptance into Nova will keep this code from becoming abandoned.   Thank you for your consideration.

The APL Development Team

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/encrypt-cinder-volumes
 
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30976/ Change I358813b3: Add encryption support for volumes to libvirt

[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/45103/ Change Ia6f4c69e: Add key manager implementation with static key

[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/45123/ Change Ie9ab9578: Synchronize the key manager interface with Cinder'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-09-09 15:42:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'created': '2013-09-05 11:54:45.000000000', 'message': "Add key manager implementation with static key

Per feedback received on other patch sets, an example key manager
driver is required to support ephemeral storage encryption and
Cinder volume encryption. The ConfKeyManager class reads its key
from the project's configuration file and provides this key for
*all* requests. As such, this key manager is insecure but allows
the aforementioned encryption features to be used without further
integration effort.

To clarify the above statements, the configuration-based key
manager uses a single, fixed key. When used to encrypt data (e.g.,
by the Cinder volume encryption feature), the encryption provides
limited protection for the confidentiality of data. For example,
data cannot be read from a lost or stolen disk, and a volume's
contents cannot be reconstructed if an attacker intercepts the iSCSI
traffic between the compute and storage host. If the key is ever
compromised, then any data encrypted with the key can be decrypted.

Implements blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ia6f4c69e699e68065c0f767e769cd0a6f5cc623b

commit_message:
Add key manager implementation with static key

Per feedback received on other patch sets, an example key manager
driver is required to support ephemeral storage encryption and
Cinder volume encryption. The ConfKeyManager class reads its key
from the project's configuration file and provides this key for
*all* requests. As such, this key manager is insecure but allows
the aforementioned encryption features to be used without further
integration effort.

To clarify the above statements, the configuration-based key
manager uses a single, fixed key. When used to encrypt data (e.g.,
by the Cinder volume encryption feature), the encryption provides
limited protection for the confidentiality of data. For example,
data cannot be read from a lost or stolen disk, and a volume's
contents cannot be reconstructed if an attacker intercepts the iSCSI
traffic between the compute and storage host. If the key is ever
compromised, then any data encrypted with the key can be decrypted.

Implements blueprint encrypt-cinder-volumes
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ia6f4c69e699e68065c0f767e769cd0a6f5cc623b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 20:41:03.000000000', 'message': "Give more meaningful error message when no servers are configured

If the user tries to create a domain and there are no servers
configured, the error message is 'configuration_error.' This
can be confusing, especially for new users.

This changes the message to be 'no_servers_configured'

Change-Id: Ic02d1f516db659a0c09838729c51ac386280f7eb
Fixes: bug#1204578
"}]
commit_message:
Give more meaningful error message when no servers are configured

If the user tries to create a domain and there are no servers
configured, the error message is 'configuration_error.' This
can be confusing, especially for new users.

This changes the message to be 'no_servers_configured'

Change-Id: Ic02d1f516db659a0c09838729c51ac386280f7eb
Fixes: bug#1204578

commit_message:
VMware: add support for datastore_regex configuration

Setting VMWAREAPI_DATASTORE_REGEX will ensure that the
datastore-regex in the vmware section will be set.

Change-Id: I72151f677d04ab6763f3f20a835825e406b0e571

commit_message:
Cherry-pick commits from release-0.2 branch

    * Use https authentication URL if SSL is enabled.
    * murano-git-install configures more options.
    * murano-git-install generates sample certificate
    * murano-gi-install configures SSL for heat and keystone
    * git log doesn't use pager now.
    * RabbitMQ host takes LAB_HOST value but could be redefined.
    * Global variable replaced by local.
    * Variable name typo fix.
    * Upgrade pbr during prerequisites phase.

Change-Id: Ie0dd8d602251f104e2b9b9c589c53244b9daf720

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 17:20:45.000000000', 'message': 'chore: Update Falcon dep to allow version 0.1.7

The latest version of Falcon contains some bug fixes, as well as
the ability to automatically respond to OPTIONS requests, something
that we rely on for "follow-your-nose" clients; the home document
does not list every endpoint (only those that would otherwise be
undiscoverable).

Change-Id: I7767d44ec7fabb69bf771b6e709f521606e6d0a0
'}]
commit_message:
chore: Update Falcon dep to allow version 0.1.7

The latest version of Falcon contains some bug fixes, as well as
the ability to automatically respond to OPTIONS requests, something
that we rely on for "follow-your-nose" clients; the home document
does not list every endpoint (only those that would otherwise be
undiscoverable).

Change-Id: I7767d44ec7fabb69bf771b6e709f521606e6d0a0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 15:03:44.000000000', 'message': 'Make show_roles language independent

A menu in the membership form was displayed depending on whether
show_roles was equal to "No", however as the initial boolean value was
passed through the Django yesno template filter which is
internationalised, this would not work when using the dashboard in
other languages.

Change-Id: Ie58eb98590296b0c9f38b3c243c7c63327755fd9
Closes-Bug: #1224338
'}]
commit_message:
Make show_roles language independent

A menu in the membership form was displayed depending on whether
show_roles was equal to "No", however as the initial boolean value was
passed through the Django yesno template filter which is
internationalised, this would not work when using the dashboard in
other languages.

Change-Id: Ie58eb98590296b0c9f38b3c243c7c63327755fd9
Closes-Bug: #1224338

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-13 11:53:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix VMwareVCDriver to support multi-datastore

This fixes the issue of VCDriver selecting the first datastore of
Cluster while provisioning instances. User can provide a regex to
match with the desired datastores.

Fixes: bug #1104994

(cherry picked from commit 9579ece88962ec86bd54d7930c764105e38f5db6)

Conflicts:

	etc/nova/nova.conf.sample
	nova/tests/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/tests/test_vmwareapi_vm_util.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I319b0d8afd03e9fef00ea0c8c799790714685104

commit_message:
Fix VMwareVCDriver to support multi-datastore

This fixes the issue of VCDriver selecting the first datastore of
Cluster while provisioning instances. User can provide a regex to
match with the desired datastores.

Fixes: bug #1104994

(cherry picked from commit 9579ece88962ec86bd54d7930c764105e38f5db6)

Conflicts:

        etc/nova/nova.conf.sample
        nova/tests/test_vmwareapi.py
        nova/tests/test_vmwareapi_vm_util.py
        nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py
        nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py
        nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I319b0d8afd03e9fef00ea0c8c799790714685104

@jd__: According to https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py#L1132 the user_id and project_id are got from request header, which is from keystone authentication data, not from the post data.'}, {'account_id': 7203, 'date': '2013-09-17 03:05:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I feel "ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py" is wrong.
You might want to fix "ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py" to use the user_id and the project_id.'}, {'account_id': 7585, 'date': '2013-09-17 07:16:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I saw somewhere, that Admin should able to change this. Though that doesn't work.

But I had a different feedback from some core, that it shouldn't be changed as it tracks who created that Alarm.

So I am not sure, what should be the right fix. But it should be one of the above. :-)"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-09-17 08:22:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I've discussed it with Mehdi and this is a really a limitation on the current API. I've opened a bug for this https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1226470"}, {'account_id': 4491, 'date': '2013-09-17 08:42:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Plan to fix in the api side, not the client side.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1226470'}]

commit_message:
Remove project_id and user_id parameters when creating alarm

Since project_id and user_id of the alarm can not be set during
the alarm creation, just removes those 2 parameters.

Change-Id: Id45ed53705a880b1bbf4813ddc7a3ef589721430
Closes-Bug: 1223829

commit_message:
Add check that task provides all results it should

Value returned from execute method of task should contain all
results that are mappend with task.rebind. To verify that we
check that the value can be indexed with all necessary indexes.
If that fails, we put warning to log.

Change-Id: I21aac7b36885668155c2d7bd2eedcf4eeba22b11

Hi Ken'ichi, See my comment.
I am also not totally sure whether this is a valid scenario test. It's somehow a negative scenario test and I have doubts that this reflects a real-life work flow."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-08-29 01:24:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Hi Marc,

> I am also not totally sure whether this is a valid scenario test. It's somehow a negative scenario test and I have doubts that this reflects a real-life work flow.

I'm really glad of your point, that is I want to propose/talk/discuss.

First about all, this scenario is different from the existing scenario tests.
The existing scenario tests are positive tests, not including any negative ones such as this scenario.
Also this purpose is not a work flow, the main purpose is security validation. So it would not be a scenario as you said.

The reason, I proposed this test as a scenario, is the combination test of multiple components fits to the scenario test category only in current tempest.
then I feel we have some options for this kind of security tests.

* 1: Tempest should not include this kind of tests.
* 2: Add new category like "security" and put this in the category.
* 3: Put this in the scenario category, and will add new category when the tests of this kind in the future.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-08-29 01:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2013-08-29 01:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-29 01:56:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-28 06:12:16.000000000', 'message': 'Add a scenario test for verifying user scope

Some entities(flavor, image, etc) has public/private attribute, and
the private entities should be accessible only by an admin and the
granted users.
On the API tests, we have already checked it by each entity. However,
we don't check the combination of each entity.
In real-world, there were some security issues that the not-granted
user could specify a private flavor as "create instance" API.
 * https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1212179

So the scenario tests, which verify the user scope of the combinations,
are good for OpenStack security.

At first, this patch adds a scenario test which verify the combination
of flavor, image and server instance.

Fixes bug #1217714

Change-Id: I778e3868bbca10ad1301c13d8df3b65864a45ad4

commit_message:
Add a create_server test for flavor authorization

There was security issue that the not-granted user could specify
non-public flavor as "create instance" API.
 * https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1212179

Now tempest includes a create_server API test for non-public image,
but does not have one for non-public flavor.
This patch adds a create_server API test for non-public flavor.

Fixes bug #1217714

Change-Id: I778e3868bbca10ad1301c13d8df3b65864a45ad4

'}, {'created': '2013-09-16 14:44:07.000000000', 'message': 'Make actions yield tasks, not execute them

We rework action-based engine considerably to execute all tasks from
engine itself. To achieve that we change action interface: instead
of execute() and revert() methods actions should have to_execute()
and to_revert() method that return iterators over task actions that

commit_message:
Make actions yield tasks, not execute them

We rework action-based engine considerably to execute all tasks from
engine itself. To achieve that we change action interface: instead
of execute() and revert() methods actions should have to_execute()
and to_revert() method that return iterators over task actions that
can be executed right now. When task is done, new list of tasks
is retrieved from the generator via its send() method.

Closes-bug: 1225759
Change-Id: I13f97adbd67021703e0b1ec96228ae0704af409e

Schedule only networks with dhcp enabled subnets.

Closes-Bug: #1213394

subject: improved logging for debug levels
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-31 20:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-trove-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/98/44598/1/check/gate-trove-pep8/19a8ea4 : SUCCESS in 5m 06s

- gate-trove-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/98/44598/1/check/gate-trove-python27/61dbf78 : SUCCESS in 3m 21s
'}, {'account_id': 739, 'date': '2013-09-03 05:38:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Great work. But i wonder if it would be easier to set this in the context object, so that it magically gets pushed to all log msgs, so we dont have to kwarg the instance_uuid every message. I promise ill forget to do it.

i would like us to track the review i just made in oslo-incubator, to see if it gets rejected or approved. thts the only reason im -2'ing this.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/44795"}, {'account_id': 6739, 'date': '2013-09-03 14:23:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd be interested in using the context manager, if it was functional across all code paths.  There's quite a few issues with the usage of context manager  - specifically novaclient and dns drivers - aren't context aware.    Pushing this deeper to the contextManager seems hackish - an instance ID isn't part of the context and instance ID comes after a context ID is assigned, so you'd have to find some way to inject it later in the code path.  

The focus is only to enhance DEBUG logging - not normal logging - so I'd like you to reconsider the vote and I'll go back through the PR and make sure it's only debug calls are using the kwarg instance."}, {'account_id': 739, 'date': '2013-09-09 17:20:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is there any word on splitting up the review into its 2 pieces?'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-09-17 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-09-17 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-31 20:39:34.000000000', 'message': 'improved logging for debug levels

Added kwarg instance_uuid=self.id for most LOG.debug calls;
Added more contextual detail to FreshInstanceTasks to help operation
teams calculate timing for various procedures through enabling debug
logging

Change-Id: Ia0d6197fef574adcb193805804630f9c3f82c8f5
'}]
commit_message:
improved logging for debug levels

Added kwarg instance_uuid=self.id for most LOG.debug calls;
Added more contextual detail to FreshInstanceTasks to help operation
teams calculate timing for various procedures through enabling debug
logging

Change-Id: Ia0d6197fef574adcb193805804630f9c3f82c8f5

commit_message:
Add notifiers when starting attaching/detaching of volumes

Added a notifier when starting the attaching and detaching of a volume.

Implements: add a notifier for attaching and detaching a volume
Fixes: bug #1216060

commit_message:
move net-dhcp and net-static templates to ironic/.

net-dhcp.ubuntu.template and net-static.ubuntu.template originally
under ironic/nova, now move them to ironic/. to consistent with
the definition in drivers/modules/pxe.py.

Change-Id: I6380c56c82ed1c14c1c4dadb6798e75b5d3e417e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 18:33:58.000000000', 'message': 'Filter out some vendor based input from a template upload

Some values in the vendor blueprint (e.g. Ambari blueprint) are not
intended to be displayed to users.  They are now filtered out at
the convert() call to prevent issues during _map_to_user_inputs
(it makes use of get_configs() and can raise exceptions is the
input is not returned).

Fixes: bug #1226109

Change-Id: Iae6afa65221f9ef7c5025c9f8d9dbc92f32da7bb
(cherry picked from commit ebf6d4b735ffa603d132a0063c1ef3f28561ca85)
'}]
commit_message:
Filter out some vendor based input from a template upload

Some values in the vendor blueprint (e.g. Ambari blueprint) are not
intended to be displayed to users.  They are now filtered out at
the convert() call to prevent issues during _map_to_user_inputs
(it makes use of get_configs() and can raise exceptions is the
input is not returned).

Fixes: bug #1226109

Change-Id: Iae6afa65221f9ef7c5025c9f8d9dbc92f32da7bb
(cherry picked from commit ebf6d4b735ffa603d132a0063c1ef3f28561ca85)

commit_message:
Merge only_www_touched change from validate.py

Do not build/check all books if only www/ is changed, instead
abort early.
This is a merge of a change only done for validate.py.

Change-Id: If81ee7c89c79e6571e2deebd98f6f596260d56c7

is properly handled, and adds support for '_page_cursor' request query

are captured by unit tests.

Change-Id: I1d6179bd58a14d19729fc882f004b6d1afccbe3d
"}, {'created': '2013-09-13 14:48:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix failure in multi-chunk state sync for nicira plugin

Bug 1224719

This patch ensures the 'result_count' attribute from NVP API responses
is properly handled, and adds support for '_page_cursor' request query
parameter in the fake nvp api client in order to ensure issues like this

Change-Id: I1d6179bd58a14d19729fc882f004b6d1afccbe3d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix failure in multi-chunk state sync for nicira plugin

Bug 1224719

This patch ensures the 'result_count' attribute from NVP API responses
is properly handled, and adds support for '_page_cursor' request query
parameter in the fake nvp api client in order to ensure issues like this
are captured by unit tests.

Change-Id: I1d6179bd58a14d19729fc882f004b6d1afccbe3d

commit_message:
Make v3 API  versions extensions core

Adds the versions extension to the core list.

+DocImpact

Partially implements blueprint nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I214db47a56bff160764340bd6793d7612d043ef3

[{'created': '2013-09-16 23:43:09.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly specify the destination dir for images

I ran ramdisk-image-create from $TRIPLE_ROOT/tripleo-incubator and then
later setup-baremetal failed to find the deploy images in $TRIPLE_ROOT
where it expected to find them.

Seems safer to always specify the destination directory for image-create
and specify the full path to the images later.

Change-Id: Ibebd6544be9cc0b1224637b365891b9b9cf40589
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly specify the destination dir for images

I ran ramdisk-image-create from $TRIPLE_ROOT/tripleo-incubator and then
later setup-baremetal failed to find the deploy images in $TRIPLE_ROOT
where it expected to find them.

Seems safer to always specify the destination directory for image-create
and specify the full path to the images later.

Change-Id: Ibebd6544be9cc0b1224637b365891b9b9cf40589

commit_message:
Convert tests to HTTPretty and reorganize

There are a lot of problems with the current means of mocking. Most
annoyingly is that we cannot differ the call to the request library by
even a single optional header or whitespace difference without breaking
the mock. HTTPretty does a better job of this because it only cares
about what is transmitted over the socket.

Rewrite tests so that they no longer do string comparisons of JSON encoded
dictionaries. This meant that they had to order the dictionary before
encoding and would fail tests where the ordering was not followed.

In the process of this I reorganized the inheritance of the
utils.TestCase object so that there is a clear separation between the
data stored on the V2 and V3 base test objects.

Change-Id: I590df65adb1d2177b4be4e016708db05131b6880

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-03 11:09:35.000000000', 'message': 'Don't need to init testr explicitly

In run_tests.sh, function init_testr will initialize testr if the
directory .testrepository is not existed. Actually, testr will do
the check before run the test:

In Python package testrepository, setuptools_command.py:Testr.run

68 def run(self):
69 """Set up testr repo, then run testr"""
70     if not os.path.isdir(".testrepository"):
71         self._run_testr("init")

"python setup.py testr" will trigger this function to create
.testrepository if not exist.

So, init_testr can be removed safely.

Fixes Bug #1220149

Change-Id: I4dfcdfa5e1e323bbc7ee3add5d9d0888a42e3812
'}]
commit_message:
Don't need to init testr explicitly

In run_tests.sh, function init_testr will initialize testr if the
directory .testrepository is not existed. Actually, testr will do
the check before run the test:

In Python package testrepository, setuptools_command.py:Testr.run

68 def run(self):
69 """Set up testr repo, then run testr"""
70     if not os.path.isdir(".testrepository"):
71         self._run_testr("init")

"python setup.py testr" will trigger this function to create
.testrepository if not exist.

So, init_testr can be removed safely.

Fixes Bug #1220149

Change-Id: I4dfcdfa5e1e323bbc7ee3add5d9d0888a42e3812

commit_message:
Use full namespace in variables in heat.conf

The migration to the single heat.conf broke references to
metadata_server_url and others, resulting in a completely broken
heat.conf.

Change-Id: Ie68c49d5b9bddbeacfb306c05cfeea70b973e433

commit_message:
Allow packet forwarding for Fedora.

By default, Fedora iptables is configured to reject forwarded packets.
This prevents connecting from the host to the undercloud via the seed
node when following the devtest.md instructions.

Change-Id: I45ae465deb03ff8e45f05b16159098770293d04d

Assume scripts are in $PATH

We're still running some scripts with the full path specified for some
scripts which are in $PATH.

Also remove unused $BASE vars from a few places.

"ssh $HOST sudo ..." will fail if sudo is configured to require a tty

Change-Id: I51dd364ad3c5e8ad793637896bf77137faa0ddff
'}]
commit_message:
Force pseudo-tty allocation for ssh.

"ssh $HOST sudo ..." will fail if sudo is configured to require a tty
as it is on Fedora.  Use the -t argument to ssh to force a psuedo-tty.

Change-Id: I51dd364ad3c5e8ad793637896bf77137faa0ddff

[{'created': '2013-09-16 23:09:59.000000000', 'message': "Fail setup-baremetal if no deploy images exist

Use 'set -o pipefail' to ensure that if glance image-create fails
because, for example, the deploy kernel and ramdisk doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I7700f8d5233cde35bba2831b63929ca5f4bde1c9
"}]
commit_message:
Fail setup-baremetal if no deploy images exist

Use 'set -o pipefail' to ensure that if glance image-create fails
because, for example, the deploy kernel and ramdisk doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I7700f8d5233cde35bba2831b63929ca5f4bde1c9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-14 17:43:11.000000000', 'message': "Fixed a PyPy compatibility issue in the test fixtures

This construct didn't work under PyPy, as a result of the fact that
datetime is implemented in Python in PyPy:

A simplification of the problem is this:

import datetime

class X(datetime.datetime):
    pass

now = datetime.datetime.now()
X.isoformat(now)

This works under CPython, but fails under PyPy. This is because PyPy
creates a normal unbound method for `X.isoformat`, which checks that
`now` is an instance of `X`, which it isn't. Because datetime is
implemented in C, CPython skips those checks.

Change-Id: Id27e7a8b00156bd9688bdb36d2c38b04785c2d0c
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed a PyPy compatibility issue in the test fixtures

This construct didn't work under PyPy, as a result of the fact that
datetime is implemented in Python in PyPy:

A simplification of the problem is this:

import datetime

class X(datetime.datetime):
    pass

now = datetime.datetime.now()
X.isoformat(now)

This works under CPython, but fails under PyPy. This is because PyPy
creates a normal unbound method for `X.isoformat`, which checks that
`now` is an instance of `X`, which it isn't. Because datetime is
implemented in C, CPython skips those checks.

Change-Id: Id27e7a8b00156bd9688bdb36d2c38b04785c2d0c

This is commit a9bc62814d in oslo-incubator

Fixes bug 1172922

commit_message:
Ensure that qpid connection is closed (from oslo)

This is commit a9bc62814d in oslo-incubator

Fixes bug 1172922

When reestablishing a session and a connection already exists the
existing connection will be closed prior to opening the new one.

Change-Id: I9a25800fe4b56eba89d550e3461ce095bf902f0a

commit_message:
Store user settings in persistent cookies as well as the session

This should keep international users from having to reset their
language preferences every time they login.

Fixes Bug: 1225250

Change-Id: I093e7a98085bf83890b295ec4a61f839b60db4db

Both of these are currently being reworked
and it doesn't make much sense to keep them
around in the code tree at this point.

commit_message:
Make sure LIBVIRT_DEFAULT_URI is set for ssh connections

LIBVIRT_DEFAULT_URI should be set also for ssh connections done by
seed/undercloud nova power managers when managing VMs.

Change-Id: I06e4baa32bcaa244b6f4f785ccd1d163637f50e8

never matches.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix and enable gating on H702

Formatting of localized strings should be outside
the localisation call (_()), otherwise the localisation
never matches.

Change-Id: I54f482b26edf42e57116e32bbf462257cd77d155

commit_message:
Fix rename q_exc to n_exc (from quantum to neutron)

The patch fixes one file where q_exc was not renamed to n_exc during
the quantum to neutron rename.

Fixes bug: 1226162

Change-Id: I77625324b378bbe0e1461e5fea77c9747ca33624

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-07 04:20:04.000000000', 'message': "Pass debug mode to eventlet.wsgi.server

Previously if any exceptions accidentally made their way to
eventlet.wsgi.server's response handler it would print their traceback.
We only want to show users tracebacks in debug mode. In production we
want them suppressed.

Fixes bug #1222008
Change-Id: Ieb11f75ebffc67bd584432cfd8eeaac010fce7ca
"}]
commit_message:
Pass debug mode to eventlet.wsgi.server

Previously if any exceptions accidentally made their way to
eventlet.wsgi.server's response handler it would print their traceback.
We only want to show users tracebacks in debug mode. In production we
want them suppressed.

Fixes bug #1222008
Change-Id: Ieb11f75ebffc67bd584432cfd8eeaac010fce7ca

commit_message:
Add missing indexes back in from 152

Migration 152 lost indexes on upgrade. This was fixed in migration 194
and 212 but one index is still missing on the migrations table.

This patch ensures the indexes are present on downgrade of 152 to be
consistent and also adds the missing index back in with a new migration.

Fixes bug 1208652
bp: db-sync-models-with-migrations
Change-Id: I9f42b3fbe891187382135f8e789f13bb2d35d450

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 00:13:51.000000000', 'message': "Don't use sudo to discover ipv4 address.

Running unit tests on a plane (with no network) and I recently
discovered that the Nova unit tests were prompting me for sudo.

A quick look showed the following command being executed:

 nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf ip -f inet -o route show

This patch updates utils.get_my_ipv4_address() and
the private _get_ipv4_address_for_interface function so they run
commands without using sudo.

Change-Id: Id9c33c9383a9f5b2e1fce1b0f5afcc2a27a271c6
"}, {'created': '2013-09-16 13:11:36.000000000', 'message': "Don't use sudo to discover ipv4 address.

Running unit tests on a plane (with no network) and I recently
discovered that the Nova unit tests were prompting me for sudo.

A quick look showed the following command being executed:

 nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf ip -f inet -o route show

This patch updates utils.get_my_ipv4_address() and
the private _get_ipv4_address_for_interface function so they run
commands without using sudo.

Change-Id: Id9c33c9383a9f5b2e1fce1b0f5afcc2a27a271c6
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use sudo to discover ipv4 address.

Running unit tests on a plane (with no network) and I recently
discovered that the Nova unit tests were prompting me for sudo.

A quick look showed the following command being executed:

 nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf ip -f inet -o route show

This patch updates utils.get_my_ipv4_address() and
the private _get_ipv4_address_for_interface function so they run
commands without using sudo.

Change-Id: Id9c33c9383a9f5b2e1fce1b0f5afcc2a27a271c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-13 23:27:13.000000000', 'message': "Translate more REST API error messages

There were a few exception messages that were not being
translated because they were being wrapped and modified
before being turned into wsgi.Fault objects by
FaultWrapper. This adds some translation handling to
the FaultWrapper so we can get these messages localized
to the client's language specified in the Accept-Language
header.

Additionally adds a test to verfiy FaultWrapper is
translating any exception messages that can be.

fixes bug 1225226

Change-Id: I3847cff0ac4b37f57eb04b27150c4e0d1ea23f29
"}]
commit_message:
Translate more REST API error messages

There were a few exception messages that were not being
translated because they were being wrapped and modified
before being turned into wsgi.Fault objects by
FaultWrapper. This adds some translation handling to
the FaultWrapper so we can get these messages localized
to the client's language specified in the Accept-Language
header.

Additionally adds a test to verfiy FaultWrapper is
translating any exception messages that can be.

fixes bug 1225226

Change-Id: I3847cff0ac4b37f57eb04b27150c4e0d1ea23f29

commit_message:
Wire in ConfKeyManager._generate_hex_key!

Rename _get_hex_key to _generate_hex_key so that this
key manager works with the super class it extends.

In making this change we also need to initialize the hex key
in the constructor before initializing the super class. Not
doing so causes test failures.

Fixes bug: 1224602

Change-Id: I9a6bd9bf96bf74a08e607af811ebbe9622b994f3

commit_message:
Remove unused method in scheduler driver

Scheduler driver code clean, remove method encode_instance in scheduler
driver, since it's unused since Folsom.

Fix bug #1224783

Change-Id: I8bd7ee55a4b522d4c628c7f652833dfa20342b33

commit_message:
Add note about new flavor ID validation

https://review.openstack.org/39441 introduce new
validation code for the flavor ID.

This patch adds a note to ensure people are using correct
numbers when manipulating flavor ids.

Change-Id: Iabecb974beb96da6e8610e097633ad9699655d3e
Closes-Bug: 1217238

Update oslo.config

Update oslo.config to 1.2.0a3 it contains a bucket load of
python3 fixes that is needed for py3 compat in python-keystoneclient.

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Allow customising the Nova BM architecture.

Nova BM can only run one architecture at a time, and the incubator
currently documents running sed against undercloud-vm.yaml!

Change-Id: Ib157cf405a40fa983f1df3fb3ed62d04262e3e81

[{'created': '2013-09-16 20:32:54.000000000', 'message': 'Check cached file size when downloading an url

In some cases cache-url fails when downloading an image and leaves
an empty cached file. qemu-img then fails with "Wrong medium type"
error on next run.

Change-Id: I23e91c52094f27248cf8452f192ad63646051190
'}]
commit_message:
Check cached file size when downloading an url

In some cases cache-url fails when downloading an image and leaves
an empty cached file. qemu-img then fails with "Wrong medium type"
error on next run.

Change-Id: I23e91c52094f27248cf8452f192ad63646051190

commit_message:
Set +C on emulated bare metal nodes.

For the same reason as the seed node: better performance on btrfs file
systems.

Change-Id: I216c511ba6ed19b3963451a99f1b096810f1b65e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 20:56:24.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore some commands when generating devtest.md.

Running devtest.sh will require some commands that don't make sense
in the devtest.md docs, such as toggling set +/- u when setting
$no_proxy.
extract_docs will now ignore lines that end with "#nodocs" when
writing devtest.md.

Change-Id: Ibcb6e25c23b4797a21a3b43fedd10e591f68c699
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore some commands when generating devtest.md.

Running devtest.sh will require some commands that don't make sense
in the devtest.md docs, such as toggling set +/- u when setting
$no_proxy.
extract_docs will now ignore lines that end with "#nodocs" when
writing devtest.md.

Change-Id: Ibcb6e25c23b4797a21a3b43fedd10e591f68c699

commit_message:
Teach get-vm-ip to wait for the VM.

We now wait indefinitely for the seed VM to boot and its IP to become
available. This is useful for manual runs of devtest.md, but is vital
for runs of devtest.sh.

Change-Id: If60fe9fd751e3d3faca65108a9cba08e0168b9f5

commit_message:
Fixes ceph volume restore to larger image than source

If a backup is restored to a volume that is bigger than the
backup itself, which could be the case if --volume-id is
supplied, we need the option to set extraneous extents to zero
i.e. set extents after those from the backup to zero.

Change-Id: I3c226b9e7429371f6cd9b9bd81071ff765712975
Fixes: bug 1225126

commit_message:
Add parallel test execution section to HACKING.rst

This commit adds a section to HACKING.rst to add some things to watch
out for now that we are running tempest in parallel by default. Part
of this documentation was taken from David Kranz's mailing list post:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-August/014472.html

Change-Id: Ie688650fc528cf849c619e9afb64ba1f6b556ff8

Hey Dan - I noticed this yesterday - but still gave it a +2 - thanks for fixing this!

However - what would be ideal is to make the conf_key_manager and single_key_manager not extend the mock one as this one is obviously for testing and should live in tests imho.

Feel free to tell me that you need to get this in asap and I will gladly remove the -1 - just I'm thinking since we're fixing it - let's fix it properly."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-09-12 18:46:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

ndipanov: Okay. Here is my take. We should fix this properly... but not in this commit.

I see this as two separate issues:

1) Code which we use in production is in the wrong place.

2) We need to refactor some of the keymgr classes.

I'm only fixing #1 in this commit. Both should happen... but I see no reason why this shouldn't land as is since we already have keymgr in Nova proper anyway."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-09-13 11:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-09-13 11:10:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Move required keymgr classes out of nova/tests

Currently the Nova default keymgr implementation tries to
import classes from nova/tests. This could be a very bad
thing for production deployments which may not include
code from nova/tests.

This change moves two required modules (single_key_mgr and
mock_key_mgr) into the nova/keymgr tree.

Fixes bug: #1224526

Change-Id: I683b0245ab6b6acf8a4ba26f96d8c505f7c7cac8

commit_message:
Set +C for the seed VM.

btrfs VM performance is significantly better without copy-on-write
semantics for VM backing files.

Change-Id: Id7f999ea17c84ea61b733cf6d0b74c95fdae0413

commit_message:
Add --print option to force printing

The use case for --print is an administrator wanting to view the
metadata that os-collect-config sees without running any commands.

Fixes bug #1213195

Change-Id: I0251f2c70574aeaa79997ce822d2a5ffbe08e345

[{'created': '2013-09-16 14:59:32.000000000', 'message': "Drop sitepackages=False from tox.ini

This never made sense, the default is False anyway. But distros
specifically patch tox.ini with sitepackages=True to test their packages
instead of stuff fetched from PyPI. Specifically settings this to it's
default only makes ditros life worse.

Change-Id: I3cbdc416c5114b49bc0b6a4b125c75c53eec23dd
"}]
commit_message:
Drop sitepackages=False from tox.ini

This never made sense, the default is False anyway. But distros
specifically patch tox.ini with sitepackages=True to test their packages
instead of stuff fetched from PyPI. Specifically settings this to it's
default only makes ditros life worse.

Change-Id: I3cbdc416c5114b49bc0b6a4b125c75c53eec23dd

[{'created': '2013-09-07 04:00:23.000000000', 'message': 'Only send traceback to users when in debug mode

API services currently send the traceback to clients. While the client
hides it from user view, it is still present in the response, exposing
the service to details of the engine that administrators likely would
not like to have exposed.

Fixes bug #1210623

Change-Id: I554ba24b7ac9166e28a8a0a10f566ed9cfa03014
'}]
commit_message:
Only send traceback to users when in debug mode

API services currently send the traceback to clients. While the client
hides it from user view, it is still present in the response, exposing
the service to details of the engine that administrators likely would
not like to have exposed.

Fixes bug #1210623

Change-Id: I554ba24b7ac9166e28a8a0a10f566ed9cfa03014

commit_message:
Remove heat::db from all the components of the module.

This patch is needed to completely remove any require heat::db that
point to heat::db that was removed in change:
I4584cdb12d1f9e624228e6ee34b4bcfbf649a12e

The patch is connected to the fact that in the cited change we
missed those references.

Change-Id: Idd9dcefd52c63e9c8cd74fc39bc4b7ba04f981bc

This fixes an issue where if you had a custom TOCI_WORKING_DIR set

commit_message:
Source $HOME/.toci before sourcing toci-defaults

This fixes an issue where if you had a custom TOCI_WORKING_DIR set
you would get errors in your PATH (which is defined via toci-defaults).

Change-Id: I2198a3dec007500dd4cd9bbed11c394f4f2232c3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 16:09:41.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use qemu-img --backing-chain or --output=json

Initial code for GlusterFS snapshot support in Havana
used qemu-img arguments which are too new to run in many
environments.  Run qemu-img using only arguments which
will exist on older platforms.

Partial-Bug: #1224030
Change-Id: I5155dac492da67a951ede978c2c46a54c239eb04
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use qemu-img --backing-chain or --output=json

Initial code for GlusterFS snapshot support in Havana
used qemu-img arguments which are too new to run in many
environments.  Run qemu-img using only arguments which
will exist on older platforms.

Partial-Bug: #1224030
Change-Id: I5155dac492da67a951ede978c2c46a54c239eb04

commit_message:
Add methods to help calculate a stack's resources

In order to limit a stack's size in future changes, we need to know
how many resources are already in the stack. We also need to be able
to find the root stack object of a nested stack.

Change-Id: Ib848bcd2e10d02dffc30dce45a2675a9f718fa7d
Related-Bug: #1215100

commit_message:
configurable audit cron and ensure only one

Prior, the cronjobs were being set if there was more than one scheduler node.
This logic will ensure only one node at a time will be set to run the audit.
Cron job is also now configurable to preference.  Prior was setting to every
minute, which is more frequent than necessary.

Change-Id: I27b760b9260963bad3459bf2eb220e2c2966eb0f

commit_message:
_validate_network_tenant_ownership must be less strict

Neutron, currently does a strict validation code
so that for non-shared network the subnets and
ports must belong to the same tenant as the network. In
the case of a "service VM" created by
admin user, this function should return thus allowing
admin users to create ports and networks in a tenant
network.

Change-Id: Ied831402d56b98a1323d30eb6a769fd2df5278ee
Closes-Bug: #1221315

commit_message:
Add DB API to get the count of stacks per tenant

This method will be used to limit the number of stacks any one tenant
can create.

Change-Id: Ic990bf84fc1aa5592504f7c423fbce953615a4a1

commit_message:
Add missing requirement for tests

Marconi uses ddt to run the same test multiple times with different
inputs - data driven tests. This is making Marconi's tests fail in the
gate.

Change-Id: I488985df17aaf551afe52457827f1163ee445fad

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-14 20:49:05.000000000', 'message': 'FWaaS - fix policy association of firewall rule

If an existing firewall rule already associated with a
firewall policy is associated with a different firewall
policy, the new association should fail. The check for
the existing association was not being made, hence the
firewall rule was being removed from the older policy
and being associated with the newer policy (incorrect
behavior). This is being fixed here.

If the association with the newer policy has to be made
the rule should first be removed from the existing policy
association.

Change-Id: I30c41d77e7fde673f0dccbc98e1cd7bd0d7b384f
Closes-Bug: #1223465
'}]
commit_message:
FWaaS - fix policy association of firewall rule

If an existing firewall rule already associated with a
firewall policy is associated with a different firewall
policy, the new association should fail. The check for
the existing association was not being made, hence the
firewall rule was being removed from the older policy
and being associated with the newer policy (incorrect
behavior). This is being fixed here.

If the association with the newer policy has to be made
the rule should first be removed from the existing policy
association.

Change-Id: I30c41d77e7fde673f0dccbc98e1cd7bd0d7b384f
Closes-Bug: #1223465

Could you elaborate on why Ceilometer is different and editing these migrations is OK?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-09-12 01:10:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Doug: I'd consider Ceilometer to be different in that users could periodically wipe the database and start fresh much more easily than services like Nova. Once you plug Ceilometer in it should heal itself rather quickly. I suppose it all depends on how much metering history you want to keep.

I'm not sure we have a huge problem as is for several reasons:

1) MySQL is not currently fully featured so it is less likely to be deployed in production

2) Anyone using Ceilometer (since June) with MySQL already has InnoDB as their default. If they didn't would have gotten failed migration errors.

We can certainly go to the trouble of converting tables (like we did in Nova over a year ago) but that process was a bit buggy if I recall. It requires lots of manual testing, etc.

So my gut feeling was that at this point in time changing the "historical" Ceilo migration was probably fine.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-09-12 18:57:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

OK, I think I'm sold on the idea of changing the old migrations.

Do we also need to change the default setting on the base table for new installations?"}, {'account_id': 6507, 'date': '2013-09-13 09:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@ Doug, a agree with you.
More then for successful work another migration we should have these changes in separated migration (new migration with changing default type of engine).'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-09-13 15:10:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-09-13 15:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[{'created': '2013-09-05 19:04:42.000000000', 'message': "Force MySQL to use InnoDB.

When using Ceilometer without InnoDB you'll get an exception
in migration 10:

Specified key was too long; max key length is 1000 bytes') 'CREATE INDEX
idx_meter_rid_cname ON meter (resource_id, counter_name)'

With most OpenStack projects we avoid editing old (historical) migrations
but I think the use case is slightly different with Ceilometer and
MySQL users could probably recreate their database from scratch if
they hit this error. As such in this commit we upgrade the initial
table scripts in 001 so that users of older MySQL versions where
InnoDB isn't the default (version 5.1 etc.) can have a working
Ceilometer out of the box.

Fixes LP Bug #1217802.

commit_message:
Force MySQL to use InnoDB/utf8

When using Ceilometer without InnoDB you'll get an exception
in migration 10:

Specified key was too long; max key length is 1000 bytes') 'CREATE INDEX
idx_meter_rid_cname ON meter (resource_id, counter_name)'

With most OpenStack projects we avoid editing old (historical) migrations
but I think the use case is slightly different with Ceilometer and
MySQL users could probably recreate their database from scratch if
they hit this error. As such in this commit we upgrade the initial
table scripts in 001 so that users of older MySQL versions where
InnoDB isn't the default (version 5.1 etc.) can have a working
Ceilometer out of the box.

Fixes LP Bug #1217802.

Change-Id: Ie2c2ae2d3b7a5575b02fe8c3cb148aa2e9624c62

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-08-02 22:22:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

The reason this regression happened is because we added support for native neutron security groups. Neutron takes a security group uuid for the update, while nova uses the name. Your change works because neutron accepts the name as well, but if there happens to be two security groups with the same name this will fail.

I've added a comment where I think this fix should happen to avoid affecting neutron support."}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2013-08-02 22:27:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Good idea, then the change in update_instance.py won't be required anymore."}, {'account_id': 7132, 'date': '2013-08-03 10:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7132, 'date': '2013-08-03 10:22:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-08-03 10:22:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If the creation of the security group (or its default rule) fails
during instance creation, the state of the instance erroneously
remains as 'BUILD' in the trove database.

Fix: Update instances.task_id/task_description and
service_statuses.status_id/status_description to failure states if

commit_message:
Flip Instance to Failed if Sec Group Create Fails

If the creation of the security group (or its default rule) fails
during instance creation, the state of the instance erroneously
remains as 'BUILD' in the trove database.

Fix: Update instances.task_id/task_description and
service_statuses.status_id/status_description to failure states if
the security group or its default rule fail to be created during
instance creation.

Change-Id: Ib740c21eed0116fe2b7baa58034be0cc7f74f826
Closes-Bug: #1183519

commit_message:
extend the floating ips range (for neutron tests to pass)

the devstack default for the external network floating ips range
is /28, see devstack/stack.sh#L271

by running tests in parallel tempest is consuming more than those so
this change increases FLOATING_RANGE to /24 (currently only needed
for the neutron tests but changed globally to remain consistent)

Change-Id: I8f7359261461621c39235a1eae8891776bd2664e

[{'created': '2013-09-14 13:58:57.000000000', 'message': "Create endpoints on the seed with unset password.

As part of commit d44b07ea22ecb195b8aa950ebc7b3186442d5d9a,
setup-endpoints was updated to call register-endpoint with empty
passwords if they weren't specified on the command line.  The empty
password causes register-endpoint to generate a random password for
the endpoint.  However, devtest was not updated to create the
passwords before hand for the seed node like is shown for the
undercloud and overcloud.

I'm not sure if the intent was to continue to have the seed node use
unset passwords or update devtest to set passwords.  This change
updates devtest to use unset passwords, if that's not desired, I can
update it the other way instead.

Note this patch also requires https://review.openstack.org/#/c/46621/
which updates setup-endpoints to accept the *-password arguments.

Change-Id: I360ad9e7dae03e5ef1e36d3bb0eedcff12221bff
"}]
commit_message:
Create endpoints on the seed with unset password.

As part of commit d44b07ea22ecb195b8aa950ebc7b3186442d5d9a,
setup-endpoints was updated to call register-endpoint with empty
passwords if they weren't specified on the command line.  The empty
password causes register-endpoint to generate a random password for
the endpoint.  However, devtest was not updated to create the
passwords before hand for the seed node like is shown for the
undercloud and overcloud.

I'm not sure if the intent was to continue to have the seed node use
unset passwords or update devtest to set passwords.  This change
updates devtest to use unset passwords, if that's not desired, I can
update it the other way instead.

Note this patch also requires https://review.openstack.org/#/c/46621/
which updates setup-endpoints to accept the *-password arguments.

Change-Id: I360ad9e7dae03e5ef1e36d3bb0eedcff12221bff

commit_message:
Add missing options for setup-endpoints.

The *-password options need to be provided to getopt, otherwise
calling setup-endpoints and specifying these options fails.

Change-Id: I6e7a836b501aaad748613b5b41977396e1c7c9c0

[{'created': '2013-09-13 22:41:02.000000000', 'message': "Removed many unnecessary uses of dict.keys

This has a few advantages: some of these locations will perform
slightly faster, it's minutely less code, and dict.keys has a different
behavior on Python 3. Also removes usage of dict.iterkeys, which is
identical to just iterating over the dict, except it doesn't exist on
Python 3 at all.

Change-Id: Ia91e97232dc8d78cf63fa807de288fc25cf5425d
"}]
commit_message:
Removed many unnecessary uses of dict.keys

This has a few advantages: some of these locations will perform
slightly faster, it's minutely less code, and dict.keys has a different
behavior on Python 3. Also removes usage of dict.iterkeys, which is
identical to just iterating over the dict, except it doesn't exist on
Python 3 at all.

Change-Id: Ia91e97232dc8d78cf63fa807de288fc25cf5425d

commit_message:
Ignore H803 from Hacking.

H803 checks for the absence of a period in commit messages, something
the community clearly rejected as a sensible check: periods in commit
messages should neither be rejected or required.

Change-Id: I49c981a089bc7f41450e58d193ca4b609d092df3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-16 16:23:26.000000000', 'message': 'Filter out some vendor based input from a template upload

Some values in the vendor blueprint (e.g. Ambari blueprint) are not
intended to be displayed to users.  They are now filtered out at
the convert() call to prevent issues during _map_to_user_inputs
(it makes use of get_configs() and can raise exceptions is the
input is not returned).

Fixes: bug #1226109

Change-Id: Iae6afa65221f9ef7c5025c9f8d9dbc92f32da7bb
'}]
commit_message:
Filter out some vendor based input from a template upload

Some values in the vendor blueprint (e.g. Ambari blueprint) are not
intended to be displayed to users.  They are now filtered out at
the convert() call to prevent issues during _map_to_user_inputs
(it makes use of get_configs() and can raise exceptions is the
input is not returned).

Fixes: bug #1226109

Change-Id: Iae6afa65221f9ef7c5025c9f8d9dbc92f32da7bb

commit_message:
xenapi: Add per-instance memory overhead values

Add calculation of per-instance memory virtualization overhead to
xenapi driver.

bug 1224696

Change-Id: I7f638751af0051a7006677b5fb3c9d9b9ef57da9

With the next step, we need to have driver initialization code called. I put the logic into QuantumDbPluginV2.__init__().
I suppose there are several options. which options do you prefer?
- QuantumDbPluginV2.__init__().
  and modify all subclasses to call this.
  and __init__() initializes driver depending on if ip_allocator extension is suported.
  This patch chooses this.
- introduce new method like init_driver.
  and modify subclasses that suppose ip_allocator extension.

Lazy loading is out of this step. It is addressed the next step patch.

commit_message:
db_base_plugin_v2, ipam: factor out ip allocation/releasing logic

blueprint: configurable-ip-allocation
As first step to make ip allocation configurable, factor out
ip allocation/releasing logic from QauntumDbPluginV2.

The next step will be to add column ip allocation strategy/parameter column
to subnets table.
3rd step will be to implement other ip allocation driver like random, LRA,
and exhaust before repeat
The last step will be documentation.

Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>
Change-Id: I3be2d2ee82d55a4db42be83c5cb922f3b7053a8a

[{'created': '2013-09-16 10:42:47.000000000', 'message': "Adjust client to account API changes for EDP.

* Added all required facilities to access /job-binary-internals.
* Fixed client code for creating job binaries so that it passes name, url and description to a server.
* Fixed client code for executing jobs to change url from the form'/jobs/%s/execute/from/%s/to/%s/on/%s' to '/jobs/%s/execute' with passing paramenters 'input_id', 'output_id' and 'cluster_id' in json body.
* Fixed client code for creating job origins so that it passes 'mains' and 'libs' to a server.
* Method _copy_if_defined(self, data, **kwargs) in ClusterManager has been moved up in the class hierarchy to ResourceManager since it's useful for all subclusses.

Change-Id: Iaee5e5359a5701abe6b694b9a2878c7ea8362746
"}, {'created': '2013-09-16 11:26:33.000000000', 'message': "Adjust client to account API changes for EDP

* Fixed client code for creating job binaries so that it passes
 name, url and description to a server
* Fixed client code for executing jobs to change url from the form
 '/jobs/%s/execute/from/%s/to/%s/on/%s' to '/jobs/%s/execute' with
 passing paramenters 'input_id', 'output_id' and 'cluster_id' in
 json body
* Fixed client code for creating job origins so that it passes

* Method _copy_if_defined(self, data, **kwargs) in ClusterManager

Change-Id: Iaee5e5359a5701abe6b694b9a2878c7ea8362746

commit_message:
Adjust client to account API changes for EDP

* Added all required facilities to access /job-binary-internals
* Fixed client code for creating job binaries so that it passes
 name, url and description to a server
* Fixed client code for executing jobs to change url from the form
 '/jobs/%s/execute/from/%s/to/%s/on/%s' to '/jobs/%s/execute' with
 passing paramenters 'input_id', 'output_id' and 'cluster_id' in
 json body
* Fixed client code for creating job origins so that it passes
 'mains' and 'libs' to a server
* Method _copy_if_defined(self, data, **kwargs) in ClusterManager
 has been moved up in the class hierarchy to ResourceManager since
 it's useful for all subclusses.

Change-Id: Iaee5e5359a5701abe6b694b9a2878c7ea8362746

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-12 18:44:56.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Disable ceilometer.compute.nova_notifier driver

It appears that the ceilometer nova notification driver is causing
nova-compute to hang.  The last thing nova-compute logs before hanging
is a line from this driver.

This patch is up to determine if the bug is related or if this is just a
red herring.

Change-Id: Ic375272b751159a64777ca73c1b64515195aacfb
Related-Bug: #1221987
'}, {'created': '2013-09-13 21:33:50.000000000', 'message': 'Disable ceilometer.compute.nova_notifier driver

It appears that the ceilometer nova notification driver is causing
nova-compute to hang.  The last thing nova-compute logs before hanging
is a line from this driver.  At the very least the ceilometer nova
notification keeps stacktracing.

Change-Id: Ic375272b751159a64777ca73c1b64515195aacfb
Related-Bug: #1221987
'}]
commit_message:
Disable ceilometer.compute.nova_notifier driver

It appears that the ceilometer nova notification driver is causing
nova-compute to hang.  The last thing nova-compute logs before hanging
is a line from this driver.  At the very least the ceilometer nova
notification keeps stacktracing.

Change-Id: Ic375272b751159a64777ca73c1b64515195aacfb
Related-Bug: #1221987

commit_message:
Don't use ModelBase.save() inside of transaction

We using block 'with session.begin()' to organize some operations in
one transaction. session.begin() returns a transaction instance, then
does some operations, and will commit or rollback automatically
before leaving the block. ModelBase.save() always submit a commit,
and that is not expected.
When we get a persistent object from database, we just modify the
object inside of block 'with session.begin()' and sqlalchemy will
update it,don't need method session.add() or ModelBase.save()

Fixes bug #1224429

Change-Id: I2204b3023c01e65950e6131cd08b4ded5564e9b9

commit_message:
test_fixed_ips unsafe xml/json resource sharing

Test fixed ips might store json test case
 related variables on the base class in way, which might cause the
xml test cases to uses the json rest clients.

Depending on the execution order, it can lead to many type of anomalies.

Fixing bug 1226001

Change-Id: Ib4585931aafcddf009a5a8001d4e14ce14053fe6

Our ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/b6ae66d05e3_remove_extra_indexes.py
call a new drop_constraint method with type_ argument,
but this new method argument is invovled from alembic 0.5.0 version,
and Jenkins is using alembic 0.6.0 version, global-requirements.txt

commit_message:
Update alembic requirement to 0.6.0 version

Our ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/b6ae66d05e3_remove_extra_indexes.py
call a new drop_constraint method with type_ argument,
but this new method argument is invovled from alembic 0.5.0 version,
and Jenkins is using alembic 0.6.0 version, global-requirements.txt
changed by 46004 patch already.

Fixed bug: 1221467

Change-Id: Iecdc453acc5fdbad28141e3c882df2f7006d5205

commit_message:
Set Django version to support smart_bytes

Djblets package won't be install if Django doesn't support smart_bytes

Change-Id: Ic6ad8aa16b4eefc8d6029cf360e0e1d8c632c488

Sorry, it seems git was tricking me and I didn't commit successfully the last time. Removed tabs."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-09-04 16:09:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I'd like for this to better match the existing practices in lib/keystone.  We already have KEYSTONE_IDENTITY_BACKEND that duplicates the KEYSTONE_AUTHENTICATION functionality, although it is not properly defaulted or vetted.

All of the existing 'backend' variables use the second component of the module path name as the middle part of the variable name.  Please do that here too.

Is this to support functionality that will be included in the Havana release?"}, {'account_id': 8638, 'date': '2013-09-04 20:24:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-04 20:24:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
blueprint devstack-support-for-keystone-mixbackend

Added KEYSTONE_ASSIGNMENT_BACKEND to support mixed backend

Modified code for KEYSTONE_IDENTITY_BACKEND according to comments.
Implemented the check for variables instead of case statements.
UPD: Removed arrays.
UPD2: fixed spacing issues
Change-Id: Ie92eed1fb5be5f875ef6633ede9c9e08daf6bf4f
Implements: devstack-support-for-keystone-mixbackend

I need to prepare a new release of cliff early next week anyway, so if you send me a pull request with the fix I will include it.'}, {'account_id': 6983, 'date': '2013-07-29 09:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Doug,

Could you please fix the encode issue in cliff? 
As you said in this code review.
Any response are highly appreciated.

My proposal just has 2 steps:
1. Add safe_encode(formatted) in functions emit_list() and emit_one() in file cliff\formatters\table.py
stdout.write(safe_encode(formatted))

2. Add the follow two functions, You can take the functions in python-neutronclient\neutronclient\openstack\common\strutils.py as example too.

def safe_decode(text, incoming=None, errors='strict'):
    """
    Decodes incoming str using `incoming` if they're
    not already unicode.

    :param incoming: Text's current encoding
    :param errors: Errors handling policy. See here for valid
        values http://docs.python.org/2/library/codecs.html
    :returns: text or a unicode `incoming` encoded
                representation of it.
    :raises TypeError: If text is not an isntance of basestring
    """
    if not isinstance(text, basestring):
        raise TypeError("%s can't be decoded" % type(text))

    if isinstance(text, unicode):
        return text

    if not incoming:
        incoming = (sys.stdin.encoding or
                    sys.getdefaultencoding())

    try:
        return text.decode(incoming, errors)
    except UnicodeDecodeError:
        # Note(flaper87) If we get here, it means that
        # sys.stdin.encoding / sys.getdefaultencoding
        # didn't return a suitable encoding to decode
        # text. This happens mostly when global LANG
        # var is not set correctly and there's no
        # default encoding. In this case, most likely
        # python will use ASCII or ANSI encoders as
        # default encodings but they won't be capable
        # of decoding non-ASCII characters.
        #
        # Also, UTF-8 is being used since it's an ASCII
        # extension.
        return text.decode('utf-8', errors)


def safe_encode(text, incoming=None,
                encoding='utf-8', errors='strict'):
    """
    Encodes incoming str/unicode using `encoding`. If
    incoming is not specified, text is expected to
    be encoded with current python's default encoding.
    (`sys.getdefaultencoding`)

    :param incoming: Text's current encoding
    :param encoding: Expected encoding for text (Default UTF-8)
    :param errors: Errors handling policy. See here for valid
        values http://docs.python.org/2/library/codecs.html
    :returns: text or a bytestring `encoding` encoded
                representation of it.
    :raises TypeError: If text is not an isntance of basestring
    """
    if not isinstance(text, basestring):
        raise TypeError("%s can't be encoded" % type(text))

    if not incoming:
        incoming = (sys.stdin.encoding or
                    sys.getdefaultencoding())

    if isinstance(text, unicode):
        return text.encode(encoding, errors)
    elif text and encoding != incoming:
        # Decode text before encoding it with `encoding`
        text = safe_decode(text, incoming, errors)
        return text.encode(encoding, errors)

    return text'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-29 11:45:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It looks like the correct solution is to make sure the default encoding is set and to set the encoding argument when creating the PrettyTable object. I've opened a ticket in cliff's bug tracker to address those issues (https://github.com/dreamhost/cliff/issues/38)."}, {'account_id': 6983, 'date': '2013-07-31 01:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Doug,
Thank you very much. I will track the bug https://github.com/dreamhost/cliff/issues/38
And any plan for this bug?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-07-31 19:38:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've posted a pull request against cliff with changes I think should fix this problem. I have a unit test, but if you could test with real data that would help."}, {'account_id': 6983, 'date': '2013-08-01 04:03:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Doug,
I am trying to test it on my test environment.

ThinkCentre-M58:~/community$ cat python-neutronclient/requirements.txt
...

ThinkCentre-M58:~/community$'}, {'account_id': 6983, 'date': '2013-08-01 06:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I take a look at the code change for cliff, and test it on my environment. It does not work.
I think we Need delete the follow 2 lines in file cliff/app.py, otherwise the logic flow can not go to "stream = wrapper_factory(encoding)(default) "

Please delete the follow lines:

                    stream = default'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-09 06:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

[{'created': '2013-07-23 10:14:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes the encoding output issues for python-neutronclient.

Use strutils.safe_encode() to make sure
the encoding output is safe.
example: stdout.write(strutils.safe_encode(formatted))

* As per https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Encoding

Fixes bug #1189112

Change-Id: If3bd7da80b204c41c714fd68373be6798b322e8d
'}, {'created': '2013-09-06 06:44:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes the encoding output issues for python-neutronclient.
