commit_message:
Update cliff version to 1.4.3 in requirements.txt

cliff 1.4.3 fixed the encoding output issues,
So update cliff version in file requirements.txt

Fixes bug #1189112

Change-Id: If3bd7da80b204c41c714fd68373be6798b322e8d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-13 13:14:55.000000000', 'message': 'Replacement of Vanilla Hadoop 1.1.2 to Hadoop 1.2.1

This patch is needed for EDP purposes and will keep
Vanilla Plugin with the latest stable Hadoop as well

In Hadoop 1.2.x version,  4 level topologies were introduced:
all network, rack, node group (represent Hadoop nodes on the
same compute host in the simplest case) and node.
Usually Hadoop has replication factor 3. In this case
Hadoop placement algorithm is trying to put a HDFS block
in the local node or local node group, second replica
should be placed outside the node group, but on the same rack,
and the last replica outside the initial rack.
Topology is defined by the path to vm e.g.

/datacenter1/rack1/host1/vm1
/datacenter1/rack1/host1/vm2
/datacenter1/rack1/host2/vm1
/datacenter1/rack1/host2/vm2
/datacenter1/rack2/host3/vm1
/datacenter1/rack2/host3/vm2
....

Also, this information will be used for job routing, to place
the mapper as closest as possible to the data.

Note:
DO NOT MERGE until integration tests are done

Implements blueprint vanilla-plugin-hadoop-1-2-1

Change-Id: I39e11c8d59f6eae317e8ebe989c113aec413b33e
'}, {'created': '2013-09-16 09:52:54.000000000', 'message': '[DO NOT MERGE] Replacement of Vanilla Hadoop 1.1.2 to Hadoop 1.2.1

commit_message:
Replacement of Vanilla Hadoop 1.1.2 to Hadoop 1.2.1

This patch is needed for EDP purposes and will keep
Vanilla Plugin with the latest stable Hadoop as well

In Hadoop 1.2.x version,  4 level topologies were introduced:
all network, rack, node group (represent Hadoop nodes on the
same compute host in the simplest case) and node.
Usually Hadoop has replication factor 3. In this case
Hadoop placement algorithm is trying to put a HDFS block
in the local node or local node group, second replica
should be placed outside the node group, but on the same rack,
and the last replica outside the initial rack.
Topology is defined by the path to vm e.g.

/datacenter1/rack1/host1/vm1
/datacenter1/rack1/host1/vm2
/datacenter1/rack1/host2/vm1
/datacenter1/rack1/host2/vm2
/datacenter1/rack2/host3/vm1
/datacenter1/rack2/host3/vm2
....

Also, this information will be used for job routing, to place
the mapper as closest as possible to the data.

Implements blueprint vanilla-plugin-hadoop-1-2-1

Change-Id: I39e11c8d59f6eae317e8ebe989c113aec413b33e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-13 12:58:15.000000000', 'message': 'Don't generate notifications when reaping running_deleted instances

The periodic task which looks for instances which have been deleted
but are still running at the hypervisor supports a "reap" action to
delete them. It does this by calling the _shutdown_instance() method
which as part of its processing will send notification messages.

However, the notification code depends on the instance object
including system metadata information, and the db queries that build
instance objects do not extend the "read deleted" filter down to
these queries. This results in an exception in the shutdown code
which in turn prevents the VM from being deleted.

A seperate bug has been submitted to make deleted instance objects
consistent with undeleted ones, which would fix the KeyError.

However the reap code should also not send notification messages.
The instance was deleted some time ago, and so messages will have
been generated then.  Sending new messages for the instance at this
point will confuse any billing and monitoring systems.

In the event the original shudown/delete notifictaions were lost
the absense of "instance.exists" messages already addresses this
case.

Fixes bug: 1224981

Change-Id: Id463860e3046e13ce86b472d46e1ff4a43abcee4
'}, {'created': '2013-09-13 16:02:50.000000000', 'message': 'Don't generate notifications when reaping running_deleted instances

The periodic task which looks for instances which have been deleted
but are still running at the hypervisor supports a "reap" action to

However, the notification code depends on the instance object
including system metadata information, and the db queries that build
instance objects do not extend the "read deleted" filter down to
these queries. This results in an exception in the shutdown code
which in turn prevents the VM from being deleted.

A seperate bug has been submitted to make deleted instance objects
consistent with undeleted ones, which would fix the KeyError.

However the reap code should also not send notification messages.
The instance was deleted some time ago, and so messages will have
been generated then.  Sending new messages for the instance at this
point will confuse any billing and monitoring systems.

In the event the original shudown/delete notifictaions were lost
the absense of "instance.exists" messages already addresses this
case.

Fixes bug: 1224981

Change-Id: Id463860e3046e13ce86b472d46e1ff4a43abcee4
'}]
commit_message:
Don't generate notifications when reaping running_deleted instances

The periodic task which looks for instances which have been deleted
but are still running at the hypervisor supports a "reap" action to
delete them. It does this by calling the _shutdown_instance() method
which as part of its processing will send notification messages.

However, the notification code depends on the instance object
including system metadata information, and the db queries that build
instance objects do not extend the "read deleted" filter down to
these queries. This results in an exception in the shutdown code
which in turn prevents the VM from being deleted.

A seperate bug has been submitted to make deleted instance objects
consistent with undeleted ones, which would fix the KeyError.

However the reap code should also not send notification messages.
The instance was deleted some time ago, and so messages will have
been generated then.  Sending new messages for the instance at this
point will confuse any billing and monitoring systems.

In the event the original shudown/delete notifictaions were lost
the absense of "instance.exists" messages already addresses this
case.

Fixes bug: 1224981

Change-Id: Id463860e3046e13ce86b472d46e1ff4a43abcee4

[{'created': '2013-09-12 07:19:09.000000000', 'message': "Add timestamp filtering cases in storage tests

Fixes bug #1224305

The group by statistics storage tests don't have any test cases for
timestamp filtering.

The group by statistics API tests already have test cases for
timestamp filtering with the same test database, so these test cases
are simply copied over to the storage tests.

The added test cases are group by

a) single field with start timestamp after all samples
b) single field with end timestamp before all samples
c) single field with start timestamp
d) single field with end timestamp
e) single field with start and end timestamps
f) single field with start and end timestamps and query filter
g) single field with start and end timestamps and period
h) single field with start and end timestamps, query filter, and period

Change-Id: I2896e6bcdca5a87b9ce4262599e77832274943b4
"}]
commit_message:
Add timestamp filtering cases in storage tests

Fixes bug #1224305

The group by statistics storage tests don't have any test cases for
timestamp filtering.

The group by statistics API tests already have test cases for
timestamp filtering with the same test database, so these test cases
are simply copied over to the storage tests.

The added test cases are group by

a) single field with start timestamp after all samples
b) single field with end timestamp before all samples
c) single field with start timestamp
d) single field with end timestamp
e) single field with start and end timestamps
f) single field with start and end timestamps and query filter
g) single field with start and end timestamps and period
h) single field with start and end timestamps, query filter, and period

Change-Id: I2896e6bcdca5a87b9ce4262599e77832274943b4

subject: Fix grammar Closes-Bug: #1225092
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-13 17:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-openstack-manuals-validate http://logs.openstack.org/44/46544/1/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/e7000f3 : SUCCESS in 2m 36s
'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2013-09-13 17:44:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks for your contributiom!

The change is fine but the commit message is not. Please read
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages and update the message.
Especially:
* The first line is the title
* followed by empty lilne
* followed by detailed description.

We like to close bugs automatically, so say
Closes-Bug: #1225092

Please redo the message and submit it again for review as explained at https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/HowTo#How_to_amend_a_review-in-progress"}, {'account_id': 6843, 'date': '2013-09-13 17:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-09-13 17:52:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-13 17:55:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Closes-Bug is part of the description, not the title.
And the syntax is really "Closes-Bug: #123"

I suggest to use as title the title of the bug report:
Change word in Network Admin Guide
or
Improve wording in Network Admin Guide

The description IMO could be just:
Fix grammar
Closes-Bug: #123

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-13 16:14:45.000000000', 'message': "Change all external subnet examples to have dhcp disabled

Make consistent use of --disable-dhcp in subnet-create console
examples for external networks. These subnets are used for floating
IP allocation pools and the DHCP attribute does not make sense.
There doesn't seem to be a problem when it is set, but the examples
in the doc might confuse readers if it is.

Bug: 1224992
Change-Id: I09f4cd0e4ab182e491b40aece55119deb99005bb
"}]
commit_message:
Change all external subnet examples to have dhcp disabled

Make consistent use of --disable-dhcp in subnet-create console
examples for external networks. These subnets are used for floating
IP allocation pools and the DHCP attribute does not make sense.
There doesn't seem to be a problem when it is set, but the examples
in the doc might confuse readers if it is.

Bug: 1224992
Change-Id: I09f4cd0e4ab182e491b40aece55119deb99005bb

commit_message:
Wait for image to upload before create new image

Ensure the instance task_state is no longer on
image_uploading before going over to the next testcase.

Fixes bug 1218391

Change-Id: Id6f8721bd215910c67bec5e387474021df13a6c6

commit_message:
add required python modules(six,iso8601,fixtures) to requirements.txt

These modules of six, iso8601, fixtures, are requiementd by following tempest modules.
But they are missing in requirements.txt.

 ./tempest/openstack/common/log.py:42:from six import moves
 ./tempest/openstack/common/timeutils.py:25:import iso8601
 ./tempest/api/compute/admin/test_aggregates.py:18:import fixtures
 ./tempest/test.py:22:import fixtures

 Closes-Bug: #1225723

Change-Id: I5a43559630714c504dba4ef79ba9ee29128dfc69

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-09 08:11:09.000000000', 'message': "Use joins instead of multiple lookups in groups sql

Currently to determine a user's groups (or vice versa) we do
- 1 lookup for the user.
- 1 lookup for the association table.
- n lookups for the n groups the user has.

The association and groups lookup are replaced with a join query.

Fixes: bug 1218675
Change-Id: I560659eda1a30635399829e1c86f06734c90f9e2
(cherry picked from commit 6f9b75e2c3bbbd7dfc5e2d414d7271bb4f8bcf71)
"}]
commit_message:
Use joins instead of multiple lookups in groups sql

Currently to determine a user's groups (or vice versa) we do
- 1 lookup for the user.
- 1 lookup for the association table.
- n lookups for the n groups the user has.

The association and groups lookup are replaced with a join query.

Fixes: bug 1218675
Change-Id: I560659eda1a30635399829e1c86f06734c90f9e2
(cherry picked from commit 6f9b75e2c3bbbd7dfc5e2d414d7271bb4f8bcf71)

commit_message:
VolumesListTest may hide configuration issues

The VolumesListTest may skip a test if we do not have enough space for
volumes. But it also can lead to false positive test results.

This change keeps the clean up part, but have the test class to raise an
exception.

Change-Id: Ib82fabb1684ee6beaac2a7c45b0b2dc8ec5d6b4c

commit_message:
Sync with global requirements

Specifically, removing d2to1 is the important part. While we're at it
though, use hacking to get the pyflakes/pep8 pins.

Change-Id: Ic4a43955526fcde313ad2f2afec8fafeb87f37a6

commit_message:
Added job status update and hook for transient cluster shutdown

Implements: blueprint edp-shutdown-clust-after-job-execution

Change-Id: Id4d36c1a65168ff87ba9632402a9b817efda49a4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-05 00:40:51.000000000', 'message': "service_statuses updated_at Field Not Set

The service_statuses updated_at value is never set due to
inconsistent column naming ('updated' is automatically set in the
base model). The result is the value remains NULL throughout the
instance creation lifecycle, despite multiple row updates.

Fix: override save() and set updated_at (following the pattern
established in agent_heartbeats)

Change-Id: I71fea5001fa1868d221f50c34605022e6a1022bd
Closes-Bug: #1199518
"}]
commit_message:
service_statuses updated_at Field Not Set

The service_statuses updated_at value is never set due to
inconsistent column naming ('updated' is automatically set in the
base model). The result is the value remains NULL throughout the
instance creation lifecycle, despite multiple row updates.

Fix: override save() and set updated_at (following the pattern
established in agent_heartbeats)

Change-Id: I71fea5001fa1868d221f50c34605022e6a1022bd
Closes-Bug: #1199518

commit_message:
Fix haproxy agent unit test to be runnable alone by tox

haproxy agent uses periodic_interval option that can interfere
with the same option declared in neutron/service.py when running
'tox services.loadbalancer'

Change-Id: Ibcc91d603f5f31c7a376e0c735e8bf566198231d
Closes-Bug: #1221726

commit_message:
Network load balancer testing

Support and test cases for network load balancer testing were missing.
I have added support for load balancer for JSON.
Till now I have added test cases of virtual IPs (vips) and some test
cases for pool.

Change-Id: I6ab258ce8a14ad0a16befbbdb06d7abab62ad004

commit_message:
Add nova::libvirt::volume

This patch adds a new class nova::libvirt::volume for configuring
options defined in nova.virt.libvirt.volume.If secret_uuid is set,
it will create related libvirt secret xml and base64 file.

Partially implements blueprint add-all-libvirt-params

Change-Id: Icf0c06d89147cacb8ac87d8176ac8a60f9b536aa

commit_message:
Use $state_path/conversion for image_conversion_dir default

image_conversion_dir currently defaults to /tmp.  Using
$state_path/conversion seems to be a more appropriate default.

Closes-Bug: #1217552
Change-Id: Iaaa462449a257b1b48fc349399bf409d7301a1e6

This looks fine, but makes me think maybe the hook structure in cliff isn't quite right. Is there a way to fix that and allow us to just have the auth calls in one place? Auth happens a lot, so maybe an explicit hook with a no-op implementation? I thought that's what initialize_app() would be, but if it requires auth to get help obviously that's no good. :-)"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-09-13 16:46:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure (yet) what I wish this looked like...I'm working through adding an extension that uses {no auth|different auth than Keystone} and am just stating to think about this.  One option might be to allow extensions to plug in to ClientManager and handling the auth via that route.

I do want to look at getting prepare_to_run_command() (or something like it) called in interactive mode."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-09-13 20:52:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That makes sense. I'll have to look at how to plug in to cmd2's loop for that."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-09-16 01:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-12 23:04:39.000000000', 'message': "Delay authentication to handle commands that do not require it

* Move the auth to OpenStackShell.prepare_to_run_command() and skip it if
  the command's auth_required == False
* Default auth_required = True for all commands
* Do authentication up-front for interactive use as
  OpenStackShell.prepare_to_run_command() is not called

Change-Id: Id330092f242af624f430d469882d15f4a22f4e37
"}]
commit_message:
Delay authentication to handle commands that do not require it

* Move the auth to OpenStackShell.prepare_to_run_command() and skip it if
  the command's auth_required == False
* Default auth_required = True for all commands
* Do authentication up-front for interactive use as
  OpenStackShell.prepare_to_run_command() is not called

Change-Id: Id330092f242af624f430d469882d15f4a22f4e37

In this case the nice way of solving this issue is having the xml service/rest_client to convert those values to Boolean True and False.

The other possible way is always converting to string, but it is not really recommended in a test case. Earlier I have submitted patch which modifies response body in volumess client, based on the below feedback

"Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Handling xml/json differences should not be part of a test case.

In this case the nice way of solving this issue is having the xml service/rest_client to convert those values to Boolean True and False.

The other possible way is always converting to string, but it is not really recommended in a test case. It would miss if the json response contains a string boolean instead of a real boolean value."

We may have to conclude on where exactly the response body modification has to be done.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-09-05 14:24:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

@giulivo:

The same test case should be usable by json and xml as always.
The xml only able to give back non string data type if we has a formal definition of the xml response (xsd or something..), until we do not have, it is better to convert the values to boolean or integer on the service/rest_client side.'}, {'account_id': 1795, 'date': '2013-09-05 21:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

The patch Set 1 Submission was related to verifying response body according to the interface in test script, but we got the feedback from Afazekas saying "Handling xml/json differences should not be part of a test case."

Hence, we have modified the Client method to return required response type and submitted the Patch Set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1687, 'date': '2013-09-06 05:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6455, 'date': '2013-09-06 05:37:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Adds verfication for Bootable Volume

This submission is to verify the response body of Bootable Volume.
To do so, added required assertions in "test_volumes_get.py"
test script located at ./api/volume and also required modifications
are done in get_volume, list_volumes, list_volumes_with_detail
methods of volumes_client.py(XML)

Implements blueprint: cinder-grizzly1-blueprints-implementation

Change-Id: Id8ac81e268abde1df8d11055079e13e67d4e7ae1

subject: Enhance exception translation to better handle NeutronExceptions

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 17:21:52.000000000', 'message': 'Enhance exception translation to better handle NeutronExceptions

NeutronExceptions have a 'message' class attribute that holds the
generic error message template, e.g. "Network %(network)s not found",
unfortunately, because the names are the same, it was overshadowing the
actual exception instance 'message', e.g. "Network 1 not found", after
translation when the exception was serialized to JSON.

This patch puts the exception's actual message in a new field called
'msg' and overwrites NeutronException unicode() so that 'msg' is used
during serialization and we'll get the correct message on the REST API
response.

Fixes bug: #1212882

Change-Id: I3965bffb1c2c2eee0af440d1ecd30ccb3bb958d5
'}, {'created': '2013-08-16 17:21:52.000000000', 'message': 'Enhance exception translation to better handle NeutronExceptions

commit_message:
Enhance exception translation to better handle NeutronExceptions

NeutronExceptions have a 'message' class attribute that holds the
generic error message template, e.g. "Network %(network)s not found",
unfortunately, because the names are the same, it was overshadowing the
actual exception instance 'message', e.g. "Network 1 not found", after
translation when the exception was serialized to JSON.

This patch puts the exception's actual message in a new field called
'msg' and overwrites NeutronException unicode() so that 'msg' is used
during serialization and we'll get the correct message on the REST API
response.

Fixes bug: #1212882

Change-Id: I3965bffb1c2c2eee0af440d1ecd30ccb3bb958d5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-12 06:42:04.000000000', 'message': 'Don't need to init testr in run_tests.sh

In run_tests.sh, function init_testr will initialize testr if the
directory .testrepository is not existed. Actually, testr will do
the check before run the test:

In Python package testrepository, setuptools_command.py:Testr.run

68 def run(self):
69     """Set up testr repo, then run testr"""
70     if not os.path.isdir(".testrepository"):
71         self._run_testr("init")

So, init_testr can be removed safely.

Fixes Bug #1224285

Change-Id: Ia74d9fff92b8efba9b72e5c7387f761144daa193
'}]
commit_message:
Don't need to init testr in run_tests.sh

In run_tests.sh, function init_testr will initialize testr if the
directory .testrepository is not existed. Actually, testr will do
the check before run the test:

In Python package testrepository, setuptools_command.py:Testr.run

68 def run(self):
69     """Set up testr repo, then run testr"""
70     if not os.path.isdir(".testrepository"):
71         self._run_testr("init")

So, init_testr can be removed safely.

Fixes Bug #1224285

Change-Id: Ia74d9fff92b8efba9b72e5c7387f761144daa193

commit_message:
Add router ownership check on vpnservice creation

Router ownership must be checked on vpnservice creation.
In this commit, we added the check.

Fixes bug 1224196

Change-Id: I14b18225f82ebe691f253fbd7645ecfc7f12faad

commit_message:
Using constant error codes instead of hard-coded

Change all hard-coded error codes to be constants
from webob.exc.py in test_db_plugin.py

Fixes bug: #1225614

Change-Id: I9e58bb84afc66293afa56968a745b798bb88bf16

[{'created': '2013-09-15 19:45:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add utils to work with OpenStack python clients

These utils simplify and unify creation of OpenStack python clients.

Becuase it will be usead at least in test_scenarios and OpenStack Vm Provider
it make sense to make it as separated module

implement bp os-python-clients

Change-Id: I47645a7b85865e737669f11e4cd57a6dc897d62a
'}]
commit_message:
Add utils to work with OpenStack python clients

These utils simplify and unify creation of OpenStack python clients.

Becuase it will be usead at least in test_scenarios and OpenStack Vm Provider
it make sense to make it as separated module

implement bp os-python-clients

Change-Id: I47645a7b85865e737669f11e4cd57a6dc897d62a

commit_message:
Configuration token replacement is incorrect for some topologies

HDP configuration tokens are now properly replaced for non co-located master services

Fixes bug: 1223434

Change-Id: I4380db4653ae4ba2c225eda79662b8eac84a55de
(cherry picked from commit c6d5f000de1da3e12d817d482f7268cbbd7aad94)

commit_message:
add flake8 to required packages of tempest

flake8 shall be called in run_tests.sh.
Thus it shall be automatically installed, in case it's missing in users enviroment.

Change-Id: I585069c461f3c516d6f4686bc890cea785afb852
Closes-Bug: #1225684

add flake8 to required packages of tempest

flake8 shall be called in run_tests.sh.
Thus it shall be automatically installed, in case it's missing in users enviroment.

Closes-Bug: #1225684

commit_message:
Enhance VMware instance disk usage

Add instance image cache mechanism, when use_linked_clone is enabled,
images downloaded from Glance will be extend to the specified flavor
size and store in image base directory as cache. The instance root disk
will use the cached image files as link clone. If use_linked_clone is
disabled, we will copy the full image from cache to instance directory.

This patch also adds support for ephemeral disk.

Implement blueprint improve-vmware-disk-usage

Change-Id: I9810ffdd1bb003f72a3f669b70c39e1d976d1540

I can't slip anything past you, though. ;-)"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-09-10 18:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-09-10 18:53:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I've been pondering pushing the use of install(1) rather than sets of mkdir/chmod/chown commands.  If we build a function for this I'd like for it to encapsulate the kinds of things install does.

Also, I'm assuming the original issue is due to root_squash on the nfs mount.  I'm surprised that having files/directories owned by nobody isn't causing other problems."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-09-10 19:15:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I'm working in a virtualbox managed by vagrant. The file ownership is mapped to my local user outside of the VM, and the chown/chmod operations to change stuff to be owned by the vagrant user is failing.

I'm not sure about all of the things install does, but I don't think that's going to fit with how chown/chmod are being used here. It's for things like changing the ownership of egg-info directories after running "sudo python setup.py develop", since on a local filesystem that leaves the egg-info directory and its contents owned by root, which may mean an sdist command fails later and breaks tox.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-09-10 19:16:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-09-10 19:17:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

To be clear, chown/chmod *are* used for directories created with mkdir, it's just that those operations don't cause devstack.sh to exit with an error if they fail (the errors are ignored, and I get lots of annoying messages, but the script keeps running)."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-10 19:45:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Only run chmod/chown for local files

When the /opt/stack directory is NFS mounted, chown to
the local user might not work. Create safe_chown and
safe_chmod functions that do nothing on NFS filesystems
to avoid spurrious errors.

Change-Id: Iaa68879e867a4426b1990d4d46164769177dc7cc

sorry Avishay... lost in the shuffle.

So even though it doesn't actually return anything we could print a summary of the task in progress.  We've been going that direction with other things and I think it's nice to give that summary feed-back but I'm certainly not going to -1 based on that.

The one thing I would like to do is move to V2 only, unless we're making a concious decision to continue both until after H."}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-08-22 10:49:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So there really isn't any progress to report in my opinion.  If you get an error message, some check failed.  If you get nothing, cinder-api has passed the request to the scheduler, and its in progress.  Nothing very informative that I could print in my opinion.

As for v1/v2, I think we should keep both for Havana - not sure if it makes sense to switch in the middle of the release.  Let me know if you think otherwise."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-11 13:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-09-11 13:51:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I was actually thinking things like a summary response on good status: migrating x --> y etc etc

No worries, we can always add it later.  The V1 V2 issue is fine we seem to have lost control there, but FYI it's not the middle of the release, it *is* the release of H."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-11 13:51:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Fails

commit_message:
Implement ability to migrate volume

Implements ability to call migrate_volume and migrate_volume_completion
APIs. The former includes shell code while the latter is called by Nova
and should not be invoked via shell.

Change-Id: I6e81d7a6321f367a356f0a0dee385221363a4227
